   21: %% Run the entire test suite: 
   22: %% ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, [batch]).
   23: %%
   24: %% Run a specific group:
   25: %% ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, {group, foo}, [batch]).
   26: %%
   27: %% Run a specific test case:
   28: %% ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, foo, [batch]).
   29: %%
   30: %% (cd /mnt/c/$LOCAL_TESTS/26/kernel_test/ && $ERL_TOP/bin/win32/erl.exe -sname kernel-26-tester -pa c:$LOCAL_TESTS/26/test_server)
   31: %% application:set_env(kernel, test_inet_backends, true).
   32: %% S = fun() -> ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, [batch]) end.
   33: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, [batch]) end.
   34: %% S = fun() -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE}]) end.
   35: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}]) end.
   36: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   37: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   38: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   39: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   40: %% T = fun(TC) -> ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, TC, [batch]) end.
   41: %% T = fun(TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   42: %% T = fun(TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE}, {group, inet_backend_socket}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   43: %% T = fun(S, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   44: %% T = fun(S, G, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {group, G}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   45: %%
   46: %%
   47: %%

  122: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  123:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> entry with"
  124:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  125:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  126:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  127:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  128:        [Config, erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  129: 
  130:     kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:reset_events(),
  131: 
  132:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> done when"
  133:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  134:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  135:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  136:     Config.
  137: 
  138: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  139:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> entry with"
  140:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  141:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  142:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  143:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  144:        [Config, erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  145: 
  146:     SysEvs = kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:events(),
  147: 
  148:     ?P("system events during test: "
  149:        "~n   ~p", [SysEvs]),
  150: 
  151:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> done with"
  152:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  153:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  154:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  155:     ok.
  156: 
  157: suite() ->
  158:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
  159:      {timetrap,{minutes,4}}].
  160: 
  161: all() ->
  162:     %% This is a temporary measure to ensure that we can 
  163:     %% test the socket backend without effecting *all*
  164:     %% applications on *all* machines.
  165:     %% This flag is set only for *one* host.
  166:     case ?TEST_INET_BACKENDS() of
  167:         true ->
  168:             [
  169:              {group, inet_backend_default},
  170:              {group, inet_backend_inet},
  171:              {group, inet_backend_socket},
  172:              {group, tickets}
  173:             ];
  174:         _ ->
  175:             [
  176:              {group, inet_backend_default},
  177:              {group, tickets}
  178:             ]
  179:     end.
  180:

  185:      {inet_backend_socket,    [], inet_backend_socket_cases()},
  186: 
  187:      {tickets,                [], ticket_cases()},
  188: 
  189:      {ctrl_proc,              [], ctrl_proc_cases()},
  190:      {close,                  [], close_cases()},
  191:      {active,                 [], active_cases()},
  192:      {shutdown,               [], shutdown_cases()},
  193:      {econnreset,             [], econnreset_cases()},
  194:      {linger_zero,            [], linger_zero_cases()},

  201:     ].

  358: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  359: 
  360:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  361:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  362:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  363: 
  364:     case ?LIB:init_per_suite(Config0) of
  365:         {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  366:             SKIP;
  367: 
  368:         Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
  369:             
  370:             ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
  371:                "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
  372:             
  373:             %% We need a monitor on this node also
  374:             kernel_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  375: 
  376:             Config1
  377:     end.
  378: 
  379: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
  380: 
  381:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  382:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  383:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  384: 
  385:     %% Stop the local monitor
  386:     kernel_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  387: 
  388:     Config1 = ?LIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  389: 
  390:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
  391:        "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
  392: 
  393:     Config1.
  394: 
  395: init_per_group(inet_backend_default = _GroupName, Config) ->
  396:     [{socket_create_opts, []} | Config];
  397: init_per_group(inet_backend_inet = _GroupName, Config) ->
  398:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  399:         true ->
  400:             %% The environment trumps us,
  401:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  402:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  403:         false ->
  404:             [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, inet}]} | Config]
  405:     end;
  406: init_per_group(inet_backend_socket = _GroupName, Config) ->
  407:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  408:         true ->
  409:             %% The environment trumps us,
  410:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  411:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  412:         false ->
  413:             [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, socket}]} | Config]
  414:     end;
  415: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  416:     Config.
  417: 
  418: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  419:     Config.
  420: 
  421: -define(UNIQ_NODE_NAME,
  422:   list_to_atom(?MODULE_STRING ++ "__" ++
  423:                atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ "_" ++
  424: 	       integer_to_list(erlang:unique_integer([positive])))).
  425: 
  426: %% Tests kernel application variables inet_default_listen_options and
  427: %% inet_default_connect_options.
  428: default_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  429:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
  430:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  431:                         {ok, Addr} ->
  432:                             Addr;
  433:                         {error, Reason} ->
  434:                             throw({skip, Reason})
  435:                     end
  436:            end,
  437:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_default_options(Config, Addr) end,
  438:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  439:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  440: 
  441: do_default_options(Config, Addr) ->
  442:     %% First check the delay_send option
  443:     {true,  true,  true}  = do_delay_send_1(Config, Addr),
  444:     {false, false, false} = do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr),
  445:     {true,  false, false} = do_delay_send_3(Config, Addr),
  446:     {false, false, false} = do_delay_send_4(Config, Addr),
  447:     {false, false, false} = do_delay_send_5(Config, Addr),
  448:     {false, true,  true}  = do_delay_send_6(Config, Addr),
  449:     %% Now lets start some nodes with different combinations of options:
  450:     {true,true,true} =
  451:         do_delay_on_other_node("", fun() -> do_delay_send_1(Config, Addr) end),
  452:     {true,false,false} =
  453: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  454: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  455: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr) end),
  456:     
  457:     {false,true,true} =
  458: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  459: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  460: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr) end),
  461:     
  462:     {true,true,true} =
  463: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  464: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  465: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_3(Config, Addr) end),
  466:     {true,true,true} =
  467: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  468: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  469: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_6(Config, Addr) end),
  470:     {false,false,false} =
  471: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  472: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  473: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_5(Config, Addr) end),
  474:     {false,true,true} =
  475: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  476: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\" "
  477: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  478: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  479: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_5(Config, Addr) end),
  480:     {true,false,false} =
  481: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  482: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\" "
  483: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  484: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  485: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_4(Config, Addr) end),
  486:     {true,true,true} =
  487: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  488: 			       "\"{delay_send,true}\" "
  489: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  490: 			       "\"{delay_send,true}\"",
  491: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr) end),
  492:     %% Active is to dangerous and is suppressed
  493:     {true,true,true} =
  494: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  495: 			       "\"{active,false}\" "
  496: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  497: 			       "\"{active,false}\"",
  498: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_7(Config, Addr) end),
  499:     {true,true,true} =
  500: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  501: 			       "\"[{active,false},{delay_send,true}]\" "
  502: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  503: 			       "\"[{active,false},{delay_send,true}]\"",
  504: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_7(Config, Addr) end),
  505:     {true,true,true} =
  506: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  507: 			       "\"[{active,false},{delay_send,true}]\" "
  508: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  509: 			       "\"[{active,false},{delay_send,true}]\"",
  510: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr) end),
  511:     ok.
  512: 
  513: 
  514: do_delay_on_other_node(XArgs, Function) ->
  515:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  516:     {ok, Node} = ?START_NODE(?UNIQ_NODE_NAME,
  517:                              "-pa " ++ Dir ++ " " ++ XArgs),
  518:     Res = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [Function,[]]),
  519:     ?STOP_NODE(Node),
  520:     Res.
  521: 
  522: do_delay_send_1(Config, Addr) ->
  523:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {delay_send,true}]),
  524:     {ok, {_,PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  525:     S = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}, {delay_send,true}]) of
  526:             {ok, Sock} ->
  527:                 Sock;
  528:             {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
  529:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
  530:         end,
  531:     {ok,S2}= gen_tcp:accept(LS),
  532:     {ok,[{delay_send,B1}]}=inet:getopts(S,[delay_send]),
  533:     {ok,[{delay_send,B2}]}=inet:getopts(LS,[delay_send]),
  534:     {ok,[{delay_send,B3}]}=inet:getopts(S2,[delay_send]),
  535:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  536:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  537:     gen_tcp:close(LS),
  538:     {B1,B2,B3}.
  539: 
  540: do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr) ->
  541:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
  542:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  543:     {ok, S}  = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}]),
  544:     {ok, S2} = gen_tcp:accept(LS),
  545:     {ok, [{delay_send,B1}]} = inet:getopts(S,[delay_send]),
  546:     {ok, [{delay_send,B2}]} = inet:getopts(LS,[delay_send]),
  547:     {ok, [{delay_send,B3}]} = inet:getopts(S2,[delay_send]),
  548:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  549:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  550:     gen_tcp:close(LS),
  551:     {B1,B2,B3}.
  552: 
  553: do_delay_send_3(Config, Addr) ->
  554:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
  555:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  556:     {ok,S} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}, {delay_send,true}]),
  557:     {ok,S2}= gen_tcp:accept(LS),
  558:     {ok,[{delay_send,B1}]}=inet:getopts(S,[delay_send]),
  559:     {ok,[{delay_send,B2}]}=inet:getopts(LS,[delay_send]),
  560:     {ok,[{delay_send,B3}]}=inet:getopts(S2,[delay_send]),
  561:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  562:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  563:     gen_tcp:close(LS),
  564:     {B1,B2,B3}.
  565:     
  566: do_delay_send_4(Config, Addr) ->
  567:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {delay_send,false}]),
  568:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  569:     {ok, S}  = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}]),
  570:     {ok, S2} = gen_tcp:accept(LS),
  571:     {ok,[{delay_send,B1}]}=inet:getopts(S,[delay_send]),
  572:     {ok,[{delay_send,B2}]}=inet:getopts(LS,[delay_send]),
  573:     {ok,[{delay_send,B3}]}=inet:getopts(S2,[delay_send]),
  574:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  575:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  576:     gen_tcp:close(LS),
  577:     {B1,B2,B3}.
  578:     
  579: do_delay_send_5(Config, Addr) ->
  580:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
  581:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  582:     {ok,S}   = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}, {delay_send,false}]),
  583:     {ok,S2}  = gen_tcp:accept(LS),
  584:     {ok,[{delay_send,B1}]}=inet:getopts(S,[delay_send]),
  585:     {ok,[{delay_send,B2}]}=inet:getopts(LS,[delay_send]),
  586:     {ok,[{delay_send,B3}]}=inet:getopts(S2,[delay_send]),
  587:     gen_tcp:close(S2),

  589:     gen_tcp:close(LS),
  590:     {B1,B2,B3}.
  591:     
  592: do_delay_send_6(Config, Addr) ->
  593:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {delay_send,true}]),
  594:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  595:     {ok, S}  = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}]),
  596:     {ok, S2} = gen_tcp:accept(LS),
  597:     {ok,[{delay_send,B1}]}=inet:getopts(S,[delay_send]),

  599:     {ok,[{delay_send,B3}]}=inet:getopts(S2,[delay_send]),

  605: do_delay_send_7(Config, Addr) ->
  606:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
  607:     {ok,{_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  608:     {ok,S}   = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}]),
  609:     {ok,S2}  = gen_tcp:accept(LS),
  610:     {ok,[{active,B1}]}=inet:getopts(S,[active]),
  611:     {ok,[{active,B2}]}=inet:getopts(LS,[active]),
  612:     {ok,[{active,B3}]}=inet:getopts(S2,[active]),
  613:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  614:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  615:     gen_tcp:close(LS),
  616:     {B1,B2,B3}.
  617: 
  618: %% Open a listen port and change controlling_process for it
  619: %% The result should be ok of done by the owner process,
  620: %% Otherwise is should return {error,not_owner} or similar.
  621: controlling_process(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  622:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
  623:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  624:                         {ok, Addr} ->
  625:                             Addr;
  626:                         {error, Reason} ->
  627:                             throw({skip, Reason})
  628:                     end
  629:            end,
  630:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_controlling_process(Config, Addr) end,
  631:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  632:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  633: 
  634: do_controlling_process(Config, Addr) ->
  635:     ?P("create listen socket with:"
  636:        "~n   Addr: ~p", [Addr]),
  637:     {ok, S} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
  638:     Pid2    = spawn(?MODULE, not_owner, [S]),
  639:     Pid2 ! {self(),2,control},
  640:     {error, E} = receive {2,_E} ->
  641: 			      _E
  642: 		      after 10000 -> timeout
  643: 		      end,
  644:     io:format("received ~p~n",[E]),
  645:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE,not_owner,[S]),
  646:     ok = gen_tcp:controlling_process(S,Pid),
  647:     Pid ! {self(),1,control},
  648:     ok = receive {1,ok} ->
  649:                      ok
  650:          after 1000 -> timeout
  651:          end,
  652:     Pid ! close.
  653: 
  654: not_owner(S) ->
  655:     receive
  656: 	{From,Tag,control} ->
  657: 	    From ! {Tag,gen_tcp:controlling_process(S,self())};
  658: 	close ->
  659: 	    gen_tcp:close(S)
  660:     after 1000 ->
  661: 	    ok
  662:     end.
  663: 
  664: %% Open a listen port and assign the controlling process to
  665: %% it self, then exit and make sure the port is closed properly.
  666: controlling_process_self(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  667:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
  668:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  669:                         {ok, Addr} ->
  670:                             Addr;
  671:                         {error, Reason} ->
  672:                             throw({skip, Reason})
  673:                     end
  674:            end,
  675:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_controlling_process_self(Config, Addr) end,
  676:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  677:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  678: 
  679: do_controlling_process_self(Config, Addr) ->
  680:     S = self(),
  681:     process_flag(trap_exit,true),
  682:     spawn_link(fun() ->
  683: 		       {ok,Sock} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
  684: 		       S ! {socket, Sock},
  685: 		       ok = gen_tcp:controlling_process(Sock,self()),
  686: 		       S ! done
  687: 	       end),
  688:     receive
  689: 	done ->
  690: 	    receive
  691: 		{socket,Sock} ->
  692: 		    process_flag(trap_exit,false),
  693: 		    %% Make sure the port is invalid after process crash
  694:                     receive after 500 -> ok end,
  695:                     case inet:port(Sock) of
  696:                         {error,einval} -> ok;
  697:                         {error,closed} -> ok % XXX gen_tcp_socket
  698:                     end
  699: 
  700: 	    end;
  701: 	Msg when element(1,Msg) /= socket ->
  702: 	    process_flag(trap_exit,false),
  703: 	    exit({unknown_msg,Msg})
  704:     end.
  705:     
  706: 
  707: %% Open a listen port and connect to it, then close the listen port
  708: %% without doing any accept.  The connected socket should receive
  709: %% a tcp_closed message.
  710: no_accept(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  711:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
  712:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  713:                         {ok, Addr} ->
  714:                             Addr;
  715:                         {error, Reason} ->
  716:                             throw({skip, Reason})
  717:                     end
  718:            end,
  719:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_no_access(Config, Addr) end,
  720:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  721:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  722: 
  723: do_no_access(Config, Addr) ->
  724:     ?P("create listen socket with Addr: ~p", [Addr]),
  725:     %% LOpts = [{debug, true}],
  726:     LOpts = [],
  727:     {ok, L}         = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr} | LOpts]),
  728:     {ok, {_, Port}} = inet:sockname(L),
  729:     ?P("create connection socket"),
  730:     %% COpts = [{debug, true}],
  731:     COpts = [],
  732:     ?P("connect to"
  733:        "~n   Addr: ~p"
  734:        "~n   Port: ~p", [Addr, Port]),
  735:     {ok, Client}    = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{ip, Addr} | COpts]),
  736:     ?P("close listen socket"),
  737:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
  738:     ?P("await connection socket closed"),
  739:     receive
  740:         {tcp_closed, Client} ->
  741:             ?P("connection socket closed message received => OK"),
  742:             ok
  743:     after 5000 ->
  744:             ?P("connection socket closed message *not* received => FAIL"),
  745:             ct:fail(never_closed)    
  746:     end.
  747: 
  748: %% Send several packets to a socket and close it.  All packets should
  749: %% arrive to the other end.
  750: close_with_pending_output(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  751:     ?P("~w -> entry with"
  752:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  753:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Config, nodes()]),
  754:     Pre = fun() ->
  755:                   ?P("~w:pre -> try start node", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  756:                   case start_remote_node(?FUNCTION_NAME,
  757: 					 ?WHICH_INET_BACKEND(Config)) of
  758:                       {ok, Node} ->
  759:                           ?P("~w:pre -> node ~p started",
  760:                              [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node]),
  761:                           Node;
  762:                       {error, {no_connection,timeout}} ->
  763:                           ?P("~w:pre -> [ERROR] no connection : timeout",
  764:                              [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  765:                           ?SKIPT("node start timeout");
  766:                       {error, Other} ->
  767:                           %% Node starting is not what this test case is about.
  768:                           %% so, if this fails, skip
  769:                           ?P("~w:pre -> [ERROR] Unexpected error:"
  770:                              "~n      ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Other]),
  771:                           ?SKIPT({failed_starting_remote_node, Other})
  772:                   end
  773:           end,
  774:     TC   = fun(Node) ->
  775:                    do_close_with_pending_output(Node, Config)
  776:            end,
  777:     Post = fun(Node) when is_atom(Node) ->
  778:                    ?P("~w:post -> try stop 'remote' node ~p",
  779:                       [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node]),
  780:                    ?STOP_NODE(Node)   
  781:            end,
  782:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Pre, TC, Post).
  783: 
  784: do_close_with_pending_output(Node, Config) ->
  785:     {ok, Addr}      = ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet),
  786:     ?P("~w -> try create listen socket", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  787:     {ok, L}         = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, Addr}, {active, false}]),
  788:     ?P("~w -> try get port", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  789:     {ok, {_, Port}} = inet:sockname(L),
  790:     Packets         = 16,
  791:     Total           = 2048*Packets,
  792: 
  793:     Self = self(),
  794: 
  795:     ?P("~w -> try spawn sender (on ~p): "
  796:        "~n   Config:  ~p"
  797:        "~n   Addr:    ~p"
  798:        "~n   Port:    ~p"
  799:        "~n   packets: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node, Config, Addr, Port, Packets]),
  800:     Sender = spawn_link(Node, ?MODULE, sender,
  801: 			[Config, Self, Addr, Port, Packets]),
  802:     ?P("~w -> sender spawned (~p) - spawn reader",
  803:        [?FUNCTION_NAME, Sender]),
  804:     Reader = spawn_link(
  805: 	       fun() ->
  806: 		       Self ! {self(), "Starting - try accept"},
  807: 		       {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
  808: 		       ?P("~w -> connection accepted - recv ~w data",
  809: 			  [?FUNCTION_NAME, Total]),
  810: 		       ok = inet:setopts(A, [{debug, true}]),    
  811: 		       Self ! {self(), "Accepted - try read"},
  812: 		       case gen_tcp:recv(A, Total) of
  813: 			   {ok, Bin} when (byte_size(Bin) =:= Total) ->
  814: 			       ?P("~w -> [OK] received expected ~w "
  815: 				  "bytes of data - "
  816: 				  "close sockets", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Total]),
  817: 			       ok = inet:setopts(A, [{debug, false}]),    
  818: 			       Self ! {self(), "read - expected amount of data - close socket(s)"},
  819: 			       gen_tcp:close(A),
  820: 			       gen_tcp:close(L),
  821: 			       ?P("~w -> [OK] done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  822: 			       exit(ok);
  823: 			   {ok, Bin} ->
  824: 			       ?P("~w -> [ERROR] unexpected amount "
  825: 				  "of data recv - "
  826: 				  "close sockets: "
  827: 				  "~n      Expected: ~p"
  828: 				  "~n      Received: ~p",
  829: 				  [?FUNCTION_NAME, Total, byte_size(Bin)]),
  830: 			       ok = inet:setopts(A, [{debug, false}]),    
  831: 			       Self ! {self(), "read - *unexpected* amount of data - close socket(s)"},
  832: 			       gen_tcp:close(A),
  833: 			       gen_tcp:close(L),
  834: 			       ?P("~w -> [ERROR] done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  835: 			       ct:fail({small_packet, byte_size(Bin)});
  836: 			   Error ->
  837: 			       ?P("~w -> [ERROR] recv failed - "
  838: 				  "close sockets: "
  839: 				  "~n      Error: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Error]),
  840: 			       ok = inet:setopts(A, [{debug, false}]),    
  841: 			       Self ! {self(), ?P("read failed - ~p - close socket(s)", [Error])},
  842: 			       (catch gen_tcp:close(A)),
  843: 			       (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
  844: 			       ?P("~w -> [ERROR] done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  845: 			       ct:fail({unexpected, Error})
  846: 		       end
  847: 	       end
  848: 	      ),
  849:     await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader).
  850: 
  851: 
  852: await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader) ->
  853:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  854:     do_await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader).
  855: 
  856: do_await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader) ->
  857:     receive
  858: 	{'EXIT', Reader, ok} ->
  859: 	    ?P("reader terminated with success"),
  860: 	    ok;
  861: 	{'EXIT', Reader, RError} ->
  862: 	    ?P("reader terminated with failure: "
  863: 	       "~n   ~p", [RError]),
  864: 	    ct:fail({reader, RError});
  865: 
  866: 	{'EXIT', Sender, ok} ->
  867: 	    ?P("sender terminated with success"),
  868: 	    do_await_reader_result(Node, undefined, Reader);
  869: 	{'EXIT', Sender, SError} ->
  870: 	    ?P("sender terminated with failure: "
  871: 	       "~n   ~p", [SError]),
  872: 	    ct:fail({sender, SError});
  873: 
  874: 	{nodedown, Node} = NODEDOWN ->
  875: 	    ?P("sender node down"),
  876: 	    ct:fail(NODEDOWN);
  877: 
  878: 	{Sender, Msg} ->
  879: 	    ?P("sender: ~s~n", [Msg]),
  880: 	    do_await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader);
  881: 
  882: 	{Reader, Msg} ->
  883: 	    ?P("reader: ~s~n", [Msg]),
  884: 	    do_await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader)
  885:     end.
  886: 
  887: sender(Config, Parent, ServerAddr, ServerPort, Packets) ->
  888:     Parent ! {self(), "starting - get local address"},
  889:     case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  890: 	{ok, LocalAddr} ->
  891: 	    Parent ! {self(), ?P("got local address ~p", [LocalAddr])},
  892: 	    X256 = lists:seq(0, 255),
  893: 	    X512 = [X256|X256],
  894: 	    X1K = [X512|X512],
  895: 	    Bin = list_to_binary([X1K|X1K]),
  896: 	    Parent ! {self(), "try connect to server"},
  897: 	    {ok, Sock} = ?CONNECT(Config, ServerAddr, ServerPort,
  898: 				  [{ip, LocalAddr}]),
  899: 	    Parent ! {self(), "connected - begin sending"},
  900: 	    send_loop(Sock, Bin, Packets),
  901: 	    Parent ! {self(), "sent - close socket"},
  902: 	    ok = gen_tcp:close(Sock),
  903: 	    Parent ! {self(), "done"},
  904: 	    exit(ok);
  905: 	Else ->
  906: 	    exit({skip, ?F("Failed get local address: ~p", [Else])})
  907:     end.
  908: 
  909: send_loop(_Sock, _Data, 0) -> ok;
  910: send_loop(Sock, Data, Left) ->
  911:     %% ok = gen_tcp:send(Sock, Data),
  912:     case gen_tcp:send(Sock, Data) of
  913: 	ok ->
  914: 	    ok;
  915:         {error, Reason} ->
  916:             ?P("[send_loop] failed send data when:"
  917: 	       "~n   Left:        ~p"
  918: 	       "~n   Reason:      ~p"
  919: 	       "~n   Socket Info: ~p", [Left, Reason, (catch inet:info(Sock))]),
  920:             exit({failed_send, Left, Reason})
  921:     end,
  922:     send_loop(Sock, Data, Left-1).
  923: 
  924: %% Test {active,N} option
  925: %% Verify operation of the {active,N} option.
  926: active_n(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  927:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
  928:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  929:                         {ok, Addr} ->
  930:                             Addr;
  931:                         {error, Reason} ->
  932:                             throw({skip, Reason})
  933:                     end
  934:            end,
  935:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_active_n(Config, Addr) end,
  936:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  937:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  938: 
  939: do_active_n(Config, Addr) ->
  940:     N = 3,
  941:     LS = ok(?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{active,N}, {ip, Addr}])),
  942:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  943:     %% ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,-N}]),
  944:     %% The point of this is to "demonstrate" that its possible to 
  945:     %% enable and then later disable debug in one (setopts) call!
  946:     %% Note the order! Its reversed!!
  947:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{debug, false}, {active,-N}, {debug, true}]),
  948:     receive
  949:         {tcp_passive, LS} -> ok
  950:     after
  951:         5000 ->
  952:             exit({error,tcp_passive_failure})
  953:     end,
  954:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  955:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,0}]),
  956:     receive
  957:         {tcp_passive, LS} -> ok
  958:     after
  959:         5000 ->
  960:             exit({error,tcp_passive_failure})
  961:     end,
  962:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,32767}]),
  963:     {error,einval} = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,1}]),
  964:     {error,einval} = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,-32769}]),
  965:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,-32768}]),
  966:     receive
  967:         {tcp_passive, LS} -> ok
  968:     after
  969:         5000 ->
  970:             exit({error,tcp_passive_failure})
  971:     end,
  972:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  973:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,N}]),
  974:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,true}]),
  975:     [{active,true}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  976:     receive
  977:         _ -> exit({error,active_n})
  978:     after
  979:         0 ->
  980:             ok
  981:     end,
  982:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,N}]),
  983:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,once}]),
  984:     [{active,once}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  985:     receive
  986:         _ -> exit({error,active_n})
  987:     after
  988:         0 ->
  989:             ok
  990:     end,
  991:     {error,einval} = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,32768}]),
  992:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,false}]),
  993:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  994:     Port = ok(inet:port(LS)),
  995:     C = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{active,N}, {ip, Addr}]) of
  996:             {ok, CS} ->
  997:                 CS;
  998:             {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
  999:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 1000:         end,
 1001:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(C, [active])),
 1002:     S = ok(gen_tcp:accept(LS)),
 1003:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{active,N}]),
 1004:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(S, [active])),
 1005:     repeat(3,
 1006:            fun(I) ->
 1007:                    Msg = "message "++integer_to_list(I),
 1008:                    ok = gen_tcp:send(C, Msg),
 1009:                    receive
 1010:                        {tcp,S,Msg} ->
 1011:                            ok = gen_tcp:send(S, Msg)
 1012:                    after
 1013:                        5000 ->
 1014:                            exit({error,timeout})
 1015:                    end,
 1016:                    receive
 1017:                        {tcp,C,Msg} ->
 1018:                            ok
 1019:                    after
 1020:                        5000 ->
 1021:                            exit({error,timeout})
 1022:                    end
 1023:            end),
 1024:     receive
 1025:         {tcp_passive,S} ->
 1026:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S, [active]))
 1027:     after
 1028:         5000 ->
 1029:             exit({error,tcp_passive})
 1030:     end,
 1031:     receive
 1032:         {tcp_passive,C} ->
 1033:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(C, [active]))
 1034:     after
 1035:         5000 ->
 1036:             exit({error,tcp_passive})
 1037:     end,
 1038:     LS2 = ok(?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,0}])),
 1039:     receive
 1040:         {tcp_passive,LS2} ->
 1041:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS2, [active]))
 1042:     after
 1043:         5000 ->
 1044:             exit({error,tcp_passive})
 1045:     end,
 1046:     ok = gen_tcp:close(LS2),
 1047:     ok = gen_tcp:close(C),
 1048:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S),
 1049:     ok = gen_tcp:close(LS),
 1050:     ok.
 1051: 
 1052: -define(OTP_3924_MAX_DELAY,  100).
 1053: -define(OTP_3924_MIN_FACTOR, 4).
 1054: %% Taken out of the blue, but on intra host connections
 1055: %% I expect propagation of a close to be quite fast
 1056: %% so 100 ms seems reasonable.
 1057: 
 1058: %% Tests that a socket can be closed fast enough.
 1059: otp_3924(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1060:     ?P("~w -> entry with"
 1061:        "~n      Config: ~p"
 1062:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Config, nodes()]),
 1063:     Cond = fun() ->
 1064:                    case lists:keysearch(kernel_factor, 1, Config) of
 1065:                        %% Only run this on machines that are "fast enough"...
 1066:                        {value, {kernel_factor, Factor}}
 1067:                          when (Factor =< ?OTP_3924_MIN_FACTOR) ->
 1068:                            ?P("~w:condition -> "
 1069:                               "*fast* enough (~w)", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Factor]),
 1070:                            ok;
 1071:                        _ ->
 1072:                            ?P("~w:condition -> "
 1073:                               "*not* fast enough", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1074:                            {skip, "Too slow for this test"}
 1075:                    end
 1076:            end,
 1077:     Pre = fun() ->
 1078:                   ?P("~w:pre -> which local address", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1079: 		  Addr = case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1080: 			     {ok, A} ->
 1081: 				 A;
 1082: 			     {error, Reason} ->
 1083: 				 throw({skip, Reason})
 1084: 			 end,
 1085:                   ?P("~w:pre -> calculate max delay", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1086:                   MaxDelay = (case has_superfluous_schedulers() of
 1087:                                   true -> 4;
 1088:                                   false -> 1
 1089:                               end
 1090:                               * case {erlang:system_info(debug_compiled),
 1091:                                       erlang:system_info(lock_checking)} of
 1092:                                     {true, _} -> 6;
 1093:                                     {_, true} -> 2;
 1094:                                     _ -> 1
 1095:                                 end * ?OTP_3924_MAX_DELAY),
 1096:                   ?P("~w:pre -> try start node", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1097:                   {ok, Node} = start_node(?UNIQ_NODE_NAME),
 1098:                   ?P("~w:pre -> done with: "
 1099:                      "~n      Node:     ~p"
 1100:                      "~n      MaxDelay: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node, MaxDelay]),
 1101:                   #{addr      => Addr,
 1102: 		    node      => Node,
 1103: 		    max_delay => MaxDelay}
 1104:           end,
 1105:     TC  = fun(#{addr      := Addr,
 1106: 		node      := Node,
 1107: 		max_delay := MaxDelay}) ->
 1108:                   ?P("~w:tc -> begin", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1109:                   Res = do_otp_3924(Config, Addr, Node, MaxDelay),
 1110:                   ?P("~w:tc -> done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1111:                   Res
 1112:           end,
 1113:     Post = fun({Node, _}) ->
 1114:                    ?P("~w:post -> try stop node ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node]),
 1115:                    ?STOP_NODE(Node)
 1116:            end,
 1117:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1118: 
 1119: do_otp_3924(Config, Addr, Node, MaxDelay) ->
 1120:     DataLen = 100*1024,
 1121:     Data    = otp_3924_data(DataLen),
 1122:     %% Repeat the test a couple of times to prevent the test from passing
 1123:     %% by chance.
 1124:     repeat(10, fun(N) ->
 1125:                        ok = otp_3924(Config, Addr, MaxDelay, Node, Data, DataLen, N)
 1126:                end),
 1127:     ok.
 1128: 
 1129: otp_3924(Config, Addr, MaxDelay, Node, Data, DataLen, N) ->
 1130:     {ok, L}         = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [list, {ip, Addr}, {active, false}]),
 1131:     {ok, {_, Port}} = inet:sockname(L),
 1132:     Sender          = spawn_link(Node,
 1133: 				 ?MODULE,
 1134: 				 otp_3924_sender,
 1135: 				 [Config, self(), Addr, Port, Data]),
 1136:     Data = otp_3924_receive_data(L, Sender, MaxDelay, DataLen, N),
 1137:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L).
 1138: 
 1139: otp_3924_receive_data(LSock, Sender, MaxDelay, Len, N) ->
 1140:     OP = process_flag(priority, max),
 1141:     OTE = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1142:     TimeoutRef = make_ref(),
 1143:     Data = (catch begin
 1144:                       Sender ! start,
 1145:                       {ok, Sock} = gen_tcp:accept(LSock),
 1146:                       D = otp_3924_receive_data(Sock,
 1147:                                                 TimeoutRef,
 1148:                                                 MaxDelay,
 1149:                                                 Len,
 1150:                                                 [],
 1151:                                                 0),
 1152:                       ok = gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 1153:                       D
 1154:                   end),
 1155:     unlink(Sender),
 1156:     process_flag(trap_exit, OTE),
 1157:     process_flag(priority, OP),
 1158:     receive
 1159: 	{'EXIT', _, TimeoutRef} ->
 1160: 	    ct:fail({close_not_fast_enough,MaxDelay,N});
 1161: 	{'EXIT', Sender, Reason} ->
 1162: 	    ct:fail({sender_exited, Reason});
 1163: 	{'EXIT', _Other, Reason} ->
 1164: 	    ct:fail({linked_process_exited, Reason})
 1165:     after 0 ->
 1166: 	    case Data of
 1167: 		{'EXIT', {A,B}} ->
 1168: 		    ct:fail({A,B,N});
 1169: 		{'EXIT', Failure} ->
 1170: 		    ct:fail(Failure);
 1171: 		_ ->
 1172: 		    Data
 1173: 	    end
 1174:     end.
 1175:     
 1176: 
 1177: otp_3924_receive_data(Sock, TimeoutRef, MaxDelay, Len, Acc, AccLen) ->
 1178:     case gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0) of
 1179: 	{ok, Data} ->
 1180: 	    NewAccLen = AccLen + length(Data),
 1181: 	    if
 1182: 		NewAccLen == Len ->
 1183: 		    {ok, TRef} = timer:exit_after(MaxDelay,
 1184:                                                   self(),
 1185:                                                   TimeoutRef),
 1186: 		    {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0),
 1187: 		    timer:cancel(TRef),
 1188: 		    lists:flatten([Acc, Data]);
 1189: 		NewAccLen > Len ->
 1190: 		    exit({received_too_much, NewAccLen});
 1191: 		true ->
 1192: 		    otp_3924_receive_data(Sock,
 1193: 					  TimeoutRef,
 1194: 					  MaxDelay,
 1195: 					  Len,
 1196: 					  [Acc, Data],
 1197: 					  NewAccLen)
 1198: 	    end;
 1199: 	{error, closed} ->
 1200: 	    exit({premature_close, AccLen});
 1201: 	Error ->
 1202: 	    exit({unexpected_error, Error})
 1203:     end.
 1204:     
 1205: otp_3924_data(Size) ->
 1206:     Block =
 1207: 	"This is a sequence of characters that will be repeated "
 1208: 	"again and again and again and again and again and ...  ",
 1209:     L = length(Block), 
 1210:     otp_3924_data(Block, [], Size div L, Size rem L).
 1211: 
 1212: otp_3924_data(_, Acc, 0, 0) ->
 1213:     lists:flatten(Acc);
 1214: otp_3924_data(_, Acc, 0, SingleLeft) ->
 1215:     otp_3924_data(false, ["."|Acc], 0, SingleLeft-1);
 1216: otp_3924_data(Block, Acc, BlockLeft, SingleLeft) ->
 1217:     otp_3924_data(Block, [Block|Acc], BlockLeft-1, SingleLeft).
 1218: 
 1219: otp_3924_sender(Config, Receiver, Addr, Port, Data) ->
 1220:     receive
 1221: 	start ->
 1222: 	    %% {ok, Sock} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [list, {ip, Addr}]),
 1223: 	    case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [list, {ip, Addr}]) of
 1224: 		{ok, Sock} ->
 1225: 		    gen_tcp:send(Sock, Data),
 1226: 		    ok = gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 1227: 		    unlink(Receiver);
 1228: 		{error, eaddrinuse = Reason} ->
 1229: 		    exit({skip, Reason})
 1230: 	    end
 1231:     end.
 1232: 
 1233: 
 1234: %% Tests that a huge amount of data can be received before a close.
 1235: data_before_close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1236:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1237:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1238:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1239:                             Addr;
 1240:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1241:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1242:                     end
 1243:            end,
 1244:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_data_before_close(Config, Addr) end,
 1245:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1246:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1247: 
 1248: do_data_before_close(Config, Addr) ->
 1249:     ?P("create listen socket"),
 1250:     {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, Addr}]),
 1251:     {ok, {_, TcpPort}} = inet:sockname(L),
 1252:     Bytes = 256*1024,
 1253:     ?P("create 'huge sender' process"),
 1254:     spawn_link(fun() -> huge_sender(Config, Addr, TcpPort, Bytes) end),
 1255:     ?P("accept connection"),
 1256:     {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 1257:     ?P("receive and count data"),
 1258:     case count_bytes_recv(A, 0) of
 1259:         {Bytes, Result} ->
 1260:             ?P("Success: "
 1261:                "~n   Result: ~p", [Result]);
 1262:         {Wrong, Result} ->
 1263:             ?P("Wrong Number of Bytes:"
 1264:                "~n   Expected: ~p"
 1265:                "~n   Got:      ~p"
 1266:                "~n   Result:   ~p", [Bytes, Wrong, Result]),
 1267:             ct:fail({wrong_count, Wrong})
 1268:     end,
 1269:     ok.
 1270: 
 1271: count_bytes_recv(Sock, Total) ->
 1272:     receive
 1273: 	{tcp, Sock, Bin} ->
 1274:             Sz = byte_size(Bin),
 1275:             ?P("count_bytes_recv -> received ~w bytes of data", [Sz]),
 1276: 	    count_bytes_recv(Sock, Total+Sz);
 1277: 	Other ->
 1278:             ?P("count_bytes_recv -> received 'other': "
 1279:                "~n   ~p", [Other]),
 1280: 	    {Total, Other}
 1281:     end.
 1282: 
 1283: huge_sender(Config, Addr, TcpPort, Bytes) ->
 1284:     ?P("huge_sender -> connect to"
 1285:        "~n   Addr: ~p"
 1286:        "~n   Port: ~p", [Addr, TcpPort]),
 1287:     %% {ok, Client} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, TcpPort, [{ip, Addr}]),
 1288:     case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, TcpPort, [{ip, Addr}]) of
 1289: 	{ok, Client} ->
 1290: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> connected: sleep some"),
 1291: 	    receive after 500 -> ok end,
 1292: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> try send ~w bytes", [Bytes]),
 1293: 	    ok = gen_tcp:send(Client, make_zero_packet(Bytes)),
 1294: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> data sent: sleep some"),
 1295: 	    receive after 500 -> ok end,
 1296: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> close socket"),
 1297: 	    _ = gen_tcp:close(Client),
 1298: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> done"),
 1299: 	    ok;
 1300: 	{error, Reason} when (Reason =:= duplicate_name) ->
 1301: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> connect failed: "
 1302: 	       "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 1303: 	    exit({skip, ?F("connect failed: ~p", [Reason])})
 1304:     end.
 1305: 
 1306: make_zero_packet(0) -> [];
 1307: make_zero_packet(N) when N rem 2 == 0 ->
 1308:     P = make_zero_packet(N div 2),
 1309:     [P|P];
 1310: make_zero_packet(N) ->
 1311:     P = make_zero_packet(N div 2),
 1312:     [0, P|P].
 1313: 
 1314: %% OTP-2924. Test that the socket process does not crash when
 1315: %% sys:get_status(Pid) is called.
 1316: get_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1317:     {ok,{socket,Pid,_,_}} = ?LISTEN(Config, 5678,[]),
 1318:     {status,Pid,_,_} = sys:get_status(Pid).
 1319: 
 1320: -define(RECOVER_SLEEP, 60000).
 1321: -define(RETRY_SLEEP,   15000).
 1322: 
 1323: %% Open as many sockets as possible. Do this several times and check
 1324: %% that we get the same number of sockets every time.
 1325: %% Guess: This is "supposed to" test for socket leakage
 1326: %% This works badly with the socket inet_backend, so make
 1327: %% some "checks" and "adjustments"...
 1328: iter_max_socks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1329:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(30)),
 1330:     Cond = fun() -> iter_max_socks_condition(Config) end,
 1331:     Pre  = fun() ->
 1332:                    %% This is not *nearly* enough
 1333:                    %% We have some crap machines,
 1334:                    %% which we need to "handle with care"...
 1335:                    Tries =
 1336:                        case os:type() of
 1337:                            {win32, _} ->
 1338: 			       7;
 1339:                            {unix, darwin} ->
 1340:                                10;
 1341:                            _ ->
 1342:                                20
 1343:                        end,
 1344:                    %% Run on a different node in order to
 1345:                    %% limit the effect if this test fails.
 1346:                    Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1347:                    {ok, Node} = ?START_NODE(test_iter_max_socks,
 1348:                                             "+Q 2048 -pa " ++ Dir),
 1349:                    {ok, Addr} = ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet),
 1350:                    #{addr  => Addr,
 1351:                      tries => Tries,
 1352:                      node  => Node}
 1353:            end,
 1354:     Case = fun(#{addr  := Addr,
 1355:                  tries := Tries,
 1356:                  node  := Node}) ->
 1357:                    do_iter_max_socks(Config, Addr, Tries, Node)
 1358:            end,
 1359:     Post = fun(#{node := Node}) ->
 1360:                    ?STOP_NODE(Node)
 1361:            end,
 1362:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 1363: 
 1364: -define(IMS_MAX_ULIMIT, 4096).
 1365: 
 1366: iter_max_socks_condition(Config) -> 
 1367:     case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 1368:         true ->
 1369:             case os:type() of
 1370:                 {unix, _} ->
 1371:                     MaxNumOpenFilesStr =
 1372:                         string:trim(os:cmd("ulimit -n")),
 1373:                     try list_to_integer(MaxNumOpenFilesStr) of
 1374:                         MaxNumOpenFile when
 1375:                               (MaxNumOpenFile =< ?IMS_MAX_ULIMIT) ->
 1376:                             ok;
 1377:                         MaxNumOpenFile ->
 1378:                             {skip, ?F("ulimit -n: ~w (> ~w)",
 1379:                                       [MaxNumOpenFile, ?IMS_MAX_ULIMIT])}
 1380:                     catch
 1381:                         _:_:_ ->
 1382:                             %% Skip just to be on the safe side
 1383:                             {skip, "Works badly with the socket inet_backend"}
 1384:                     end;
 1385:                 _ ->
 1386:                     ok
 1387:             end;
 1388:         false ->
 1389:             ok
 1390:     end.
 1391: 
 1392:    
 1393: do_iter_max_socks(Config, Addr, Tries, Node) ->
 1394:     Self = self(),
 1395:     L = iter_max_socks_run(
 1396:           Node,
 1397:           fun() ->
 1398:                   exit(iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Self, Tries, initialize))
 1399:           end),
 1400:     ?P("Result: "
 1401:        "~n   ~p", [L]),
 1402:     all_equal(L),
 1403:     {comment, "Max sockets: " ++ integer_to_list(hd(L))}.
 1404: 
 1405: iter_max_socks_run(Node, F) ->
 1406:     try erlang:spawn_opt(Node, F, [monitor]) of
 1407:         {Pid, MRef} when is_pid(Pid) andalso is_reference(MRef) ->
 1408:             iter_max_socks_await_runner(Node, Pid, MRef);
 1409:         _Any ->
 1410:             ?P("Unexpected process start result: "
 1411:                "~n   ~p", [_Any]),
 1412:             {skip, "Failed starting iterator (remote) process"}
 1413:     catch
 1414:         C:E:S ->
 1415:             ?P("Failed starting iterator (remote) process: "
 1416:                "~n   Class: ~p"
 1417:                "~n   Error: ~p"
 1418:                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 1419:             {skip, "Failed starting iterator (remote) process"}
 1420:     end.
 1421: 
 1422: iter_max_socks_await_runner(Node, Pid, MRef) ->
 1423:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
 1424:     Start = millis(),
 1425:     iter_max_socks_await_runner2(Node, Pid, MRef, Start, Start).
 1426: 
 1427: iter_max_socks_await_runner2(Node, Pid, MRef, Start, Timestamp) ->
 1428:     receive
 1429:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, Res} ->
 1430:             T = millis(),
 1431:             ?P("received runner result after ~w ms "
 1432:                  "(~w ms since last status)", [T - Start, T - Timestamp]),
 1433:             erlang:monitor_node(Node, false),
 1434:             Res;
 1435: 
 1436:         {nodedown, Node} = NODEDOWN ->
 1437:             ?P("Received unexpected ~p 'nodedown'", [Node]),
 1438:             NODEDOWN;
 1439: 
 1440:         {status, Action, Info} ->
 1441:             T = millis(),
 1442:             ?P("Received status message (after ~w ms) from the runner ~p: "
 1443:                "~n   ~p => ~p", [T - Timestamp, Pid, Action, Info]),
 1444:             iter_max_socks_await_runner2(Node, Pid, MRef, Start, T);
 1445: 
 1446:         Any ->
 1447:             ?P("Received unexpected message while waiting for the runner ~p: "
 1448:                "~n   ~p", [Pid, Any]),
 1449:             iter_max_socks_await_runner2(Node, Pid, MRef, Start, Timestamp)
 1450: 
 1451:     after 5000 ->
 1452:             ?P("timeout while waiting for the runner ~p", [Pid]),
 1453:             iter_max_socks_await_runner2(Node, Pid, MRef, Start, Timestamp)
 1454:     end.
 1455: 
 1456:              
 1457: iter_max_socks_runner(_Config, _Addr, _Parent, 0, _) ->
 1458:     ?P("iter_max_socks_runner(0,-) -> done"),
 1459:     [];
 1460: iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N, initialize = First) ->
 1461:     ?P("iter_max_socks_runner(~w,~w) -> entry", [N, First]),
 1462:     Parent ! {status, start_socks_counting, First},
 1463:     MS = max_socks(Config, Addr),
 1464:     [MS|iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N-1, MS)];
 1465: iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N, failed = First) ->
 1466:     ?P("iter_max_socks_runner(~w,~w) -> entry", [N, First]),
 1467:     Parent ! {status, start_socks_counting, First},
 1468:     MS = max_socks(Config, Addr),
 1469:     [MS|iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N-1, First)];
 1470: iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N, First) when is_integer(First) ->
 1471:     ?P("iter_max_socks_runner(~w,~w) -> entry", [N, First]),
 1472:     Parent ! {status, start_socks_counting, First},
 1473:     MS = max_socks(Config, Addr),
 1474:     if
 1475:         (MS =:= First) -> 
 1476: 	    [MS|iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N-1, First)];
 1477:        true ->
 1478: 	    ?P("~w =/= ~w => sleeping for ~p seconds...",
 1479:                [MS, First, ?RETRY_SLEEP/1000]), 
 1480: 	    receive after ?RETRY_SLEEP -> ok end,
 1481: 	    ?P("iter_max_socks_runner(~w,~w) -> trying again", [N, First]),
 1482:             Parent ! {status, retry_socks_counting, {First, MS}},
 1483: 	    RetryMS = max_socks(Config, Addr),
 1484: 	    if RetryMS == First ->
 1485:                     [RetryMS|iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N-1, First)];
 1486:                true ->
 1487:                     [RetryMS|iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N-1, failed)]
 1488:             end
 1489:     end.
 1490: 
 1491: all_equal({skip, _} = SKIP) ->
 1492:     throw(SKIP);
 1493: all_equal([]) ->
 1494:     ok;
 1495: all_equal([Rule | T]) ->
 1496:     all_equal(Rule, T).
 1497: 
 1498: all_equal(Rule, [Rule | T]) ->
 1499:     all_equal(Rule, T);
 1500: all_equal(_, [_ | _]) ->
 1501:     ct:sleep(?RECOVER_SLEEP), % Wait a while and *hope* that we'll
 1502:                               % recover so other tests won't be
 1503:                               % affected.
 1504:     ct:fail(max_socket_mismatch);
 1505: all_equal(_Rule, []) ->
 1506:     ok.
 1507: 
 1508: max_socks(Config, Addr) ->
 1509:     put(state, open),
 1510:     Socks = case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 1511: 		true ->
 1512: 		    case os:type() of
 1513: 			{win32, nt} ->
 1514: 			    %% 'socket' behaves differently
 1515: 			    %% on Windows, so this test case
 1516: 			    %% needs a lot of tweaking...
 1517: 			    open_socks(Config,
 1518: 				       ?IMS_MAX_ULIMIT div 2,
 1519: 				       Addr);
 1520: 			_ ->
 1521: 			    open_socks(Config, ?IMS_MAX_ULIMIT, Addr)
 1522: 		    end;
 1523: 		_ ->
 1524: 		    open_socks(Config, ?IMS_MAX_ULIMIT, Addr)
 1525: 
 1526: 	    end,			    
 1527:     N = length(Socks),
 1528:     put(state, close),
 1529:     lists:foreach(fun(S) -> ok = gen_tcp:close(S) end, Socks),
 1530:     put(state, ready),
 1531:     ?P("Got ~p sockets", [N]),
 1532:     N.
 1533: 
 1534: %% We loop *either* until:
 1535: %% a) We cannot create more sockets
 1536: %% b) We have reached the max number of open sockets.
 1537: %%    Going passed this limit will make the system unstable
 1538: open_socks(Config, N, Addr) ->
 1539:     case ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]) of
 1540: 	{ok, L} ->
 1541: 	    {ok, {_, Port}} = inet:sockname(L),
 1542: 	    [L | connect_accept(Config, N-1, L, Addr, Port)];
 1543: 	_ ->
 1544: 	    []
 1545:     end.
 1546: 
 1547: 
 1548: connect_accept(Config, N, L, Addr, Port) when (N > 0) ->
 1549:     case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{ip, Addr}]) of
 1550: 	{ok, C} ->
 1551: 	    [C | do_accept(Config, N-1, L, Addr, Port)];
 1552: 	_ ->
 1553: 	    []
 1554:     end;
 1555: connect_accept(_, _, _, _, _) ->
 1556:     [].
 1557: 
 1558: 
 1559: do_accept(Config, N, L, Addr, Port) ->
 1560:     case gen_tcp:accept(L) of
 1561: 	{ok, A} -> [A | connect_accept(Config, N-1, L, Addr, Port)];
 1562: 	_ -> []
 1563:     end.
 1564: 
 1565: start_node(Name) ->
 1566:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1567:     ?START_NODE(Name, "-pa " ++ Pa).
 1568: 
 1569: %% start_node(Name0, InetBackend) ->
 1570: %%     Name = list_to_atom(?F("~w_~w", [Name0, InetBackend])),
 1571: %%     start_node(Name).
 1572: 
 1573: start_remote_node(Name0, InetBackend) ->
 1574:      Name = list_to_atom(?F("~w_~w", [Name0, InetBackend])),
 1575:      Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1576:      Opts = [{remote, true}, {fail_on_error, false}],
 1577:      ?START_NODE(Name, "-pa " ++ Pa, Opts).
 1578: 
 1579: %% Tests that when 'the other side' on a passive socket closes, the
 1580: %% connecting side can still read until the end of data.
 1581: passive_sockets(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1582:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1583:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1584:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1585:                             Addr;
 1586:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1587:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1588:                     end
 1589:            end,
 1590:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_passive_sockets(Config, Addr) end,
 1591:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1592:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1593: 
 1594: 
 1595: do_passive_sockets(Config, Addr) ->
 1596:     ME = self(),
 1597:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1598:                        passive_sockets_server(Config,
 1599:                                               [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}],
 1600:                                               ME)
 1601:                end),
 1602:     receive
 1603:         {socket,Port} -> ok
 1604:     end,
 1605:     ct:sleep(500),
 1606:     case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]) of
 1607:         {ok, Sock} ->
 1608:             passive_sockets_read(Sock);
 1609:         {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 1610:             {skip, connect_failed_str(Reason)};
 1611:         Error ->
 1612:             ct:fail({"Could not connect to server", Error})
 1613:     end.
 1614: 
 1615: %%
 1616: %% Read until we get an {error, closed}. If we get another error, this test case
 1617: %% should fail.
 1618: %%
 1619: passive_sockets_read(Sock) ->
 1620:     case gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0, 2000) of
 1621: 	{ok, Data} ->
 1622: 	    io:format("Received ~p bytes~n", [length(Data)]),
 1623: 	    passive_sockets_read(Sock);
 1624: 	{error, closed} ->
 1625: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock);
 1626: 	Error ->
 1627: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 1628: 	    ct:fail({"Did not get {error, closed} before other error", Error})
 1629:     end.
 1630: 
 1631: passive_sockets_server(Config, Opts, Parent) ->
 1632:     case ?LISTEN(Config, 0, Opts) of
 1633:         {ok, LSock} ->
 1634:             {ok,{_,Port}} = inet:sockname(LSock),
 1635:             Parent ! {socket,Port},
 1636:             passive_sockets_server_accept(LSock);
 1637:         Error ->
 1638:             ct:fail({"Could not create listen socket", Error})
 1639:     end.
 1640: 
 1641: passive_sockets_server_accept(Sock) ->
 1642:     case gen_tcp:accept(Sock) of
 1643:         {ok, Socket} ->
 1644:             timer:sleep(500),			% Simulate latency
 1645:             passive_sockets_server_send(Socket, 5),
 1646:             passive_sockets_server_accept(Sock);
 1647:         Error ->
 1648:             ct:fail({"Could not accept connection", Error})
 1649:     end.
 1650: 
 1651: passive_sockets_server_send(Socket, 0) ->
 1652:     io:format("Closing other end..~n", []),
 1653:     gen_tcp:close(Socket);
 1654: passive_sockets_server_send(Socket, X) ->
 1655:     Data = lists:duplicate(1024*X, $a),
 1656:     case gen_tcp:send(Socket, Data) of
 1657:         ok ->
 1658:             ct:sleep(50),   % Simulate some processing.
 1659:             passive_sockets_server_send(Socket, X-1);
 1660:         {error, _Reason} ->
 1661:             ct:fail("Failed to send data")
 1662:     end.
 1663: 
 1664: 
 1665: %% Tests the return value from gen_tcp:accept when
 1666: %% the socket is closed from another process. (OTP-3817)
 1667: accept_closed_by_other_process(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1668:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1669:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1670:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1671:                             Addr;
 1672:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1673:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1674:                     end
 1675:            end,
 1676:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_accept_closed_by_other_process(Config, Addr) end,
 1677:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1678:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1679: 
 1680: do_accept_closed_by_other_process(Config, Addr) ->
 1681:     Parent = self(),
 1682:     {ok, ListenSocket} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 1683:     Child =
 1684: 	spawn_link(
 1685: 	  fun() ->
 1686: 		  Parent ! {self(), gen_tcp:accept(ListenSocket)}
 1687: 	  end),
 1688:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1689:     ok = gen_tcp:close(ListenSocket),
 1690:     receive
 1691:         {Child, {error, closed}} ->
 1692:             ok;
 1693:         {Child, Other} ->
 1694:             ct:fail({"Wrong result of gen_tcp:accept", Other})
 1695:     end.
 1696: 
 1697: repeat(N, Fun) ->
 1698:     repeat(N, N, Fun).
 1699: 
 1700: repeat(N, T, Fun) when is_integer(N), N > 0 ->
 1701:     Fun(T-N),
 1702:     repeat(N-1, T, Fun);
 1703: repeat(_, _, _) ->
 1704:     ok.
 1705: 
 1706: 
 1707: %% Tests the response when using a closed socket as argument.
 1708: closed_socket(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1709:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1710:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1711:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1712:                             Addr;
 1713:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1714:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1715:                     end
 1716:            end,
 1717:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_closed_socket(Config, Addr) end,
 1718:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1719:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1720: 
 1721: do_closed_socket(Config, Addr) ->
 1722:     {ok, LS1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 1723:     erlang:yield(),
 1724:     ok = gen_tcp:close(LS1),
 1725:     %% If the following delay is uncommented, the result error values
 1726:     %% below will change from {error, einval} to {error, closed} since
 1727:     %% inet_db then will have noticed that the socket is closed.
 1728:     %% This is a scheduling issue, i.e when the gen_server in 
 1729:     %% in inet_db processes the 'EXIT' message from the port,
 1730:     %% the socket is unregistered.
 1731:     %%
 1732:     %% ct:sleep({seconds,2})
 1733:     %%
 1734:     {error, R_send}   = gen_tcp:send(LS1, "data"),
 1735:     {error, R_recv}   = gen_tcp:recv(LS1, 17),
 1736:     {error, R_accept} = gen_tcp:accept(LS1),
 1737:     {error, R_controlling_process} =
 1738: 	gen_tcp:controlling_process(LS1, self()),
 1739:     %%
 1740:     ok = ?P("R_send = ~p", [R_send]),
 1741:     ok = ?P("R_recv = ~p", [R_recv]),
 1742:     ok = ?P("R_accept = ~p", [R_accept]),
 1743:     ok = ?P("R_controlling_process = ~p", [R_controlling_process]),
 1744:     ok.
 1745: 
 1746: %%%
 1747: %%% Test using the gen_tcp:shutdown/2 function using a sort server.
 1748: %%% 
 1749: 
 1750: shutdown_active(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1751:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1752:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1753:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1754:                             Addr;
 1755:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1756:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1757:                     end
 1758:            end,
 1759:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> shutdown_common(Config, Addr, true) end,
 1760:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1761:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1762: 
 1763: shutdown_passive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1764:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1765:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1766:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1767:                             Addr;
 1768:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1769:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1770:                     end
 1771:            end,
 1772:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> shutdown_common(Config, Addr, false) end,
 1773:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1774:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1775: 
 1776: shutdown_common(Config, Addr, Active) ->
 1777:     ?P("start sort server"),
 1778:     P = sort_server(Config, Addr, Active),
 1779:     ?P("Sort server port: ~p", [P]),
 1780: 
 1781: 
 1782:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, []),
 1783:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, ["glurf"]),
 1784:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, ["abc","nisse","dum"]),
 1785: 
 1786:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, [lists:reverse(integer_to_list(I)) || I <- lists:seq(25, 255)]),
 1787:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, [lists:reverse(integer_to_list(I)) || I <- lists:seq(77, 999)]),
 1788:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, [lists:reverse(integer_to_list(I)) || I <- lists:seq(25, 55)]),
 1789:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, []),
 1790:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, ["apa"]),
 1791:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, ["kluns","gorilla"]),
 1792:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, [lists:reverse(integer_to_list(I)) || I <- lists:seq(25, 1233)]),
 1793:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, []),
 1794:     receive
 1795: 	Any ->
 1796: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_message,Any})
 1797:     after 0 -> ok
 1798:     end.
 1799: 
 1800: do_sort(Config, Addr, P, List0) ->
 1801:     ?P("Sort: "
 1802:        "~n   ~p", [List0]),
 1803:     List = [El++"\n" || El <- List0],
 1804:     S = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, P, [{ip, Addr}, {packet,line}]) of
 1805:             {ok, Socket} ->
 1806:                 Socket;
 1807:             {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 1808:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 1809:         end,
 1810:     %% ok = inet:setopts(S, [{debug, true}]),
 1811:     send_lines(S, List),
 1812:     ok = gen_tcp:shutdown(S, write),
 1813:     Lines = collect_lines(S, true),
 1814:     ?P("Collected: "
 1815:        "~n   ~p", [Lines]),
 1816:     SortedLines = lists:sort(List),
 1817:     ?P("Sorted: "
 1818:        "~n   ~p", [SortedLines]),
 1819:     Lines = SortedLines,
 1820:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S).
 1821: 
 1822: sort_server(Config, Addr, Active) ->
 1823:     Opts = [{ip, Addr}, {exit_on_close,false},{packet,line},{active,Active}],
 1824:     {ok,L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, Opts),
 1825:     Go = make_ref(),
 1826:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() ->
 1827:                              receive Go -> sort_server_1(L, Active) end
 1828:                      end),
 1829:     ok = gen_tcp:controlling_process(L, Pid),
 1830:     Pid ! Go,
 1831:     {ok,Port} = inet:port(L),
 1832:     Port.
 1833: 
 1834: sort_server_1(L, Active) ->
 1835:     {ok,S} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 1836:     Go = make_ref(),
 1837:     Sorter = spawn(fun() -> receive Go -> sorter(S, Active) end end),
 1838:     ok = gen_tcp:controlling_process(S, Sorter),
 1839:     Sorter ! Go,
 1840:     sort_server_1(L, Active).
 1841: 
 1842: sorter(S, Active) ->
 1843:     Lines = collect_lines(S, Active),
 1844:     send_lines(S, lists:sort(Lines)),
 1845:     gen_tcp:shutdown(S, write),
 1846:     gen_tcp:close(S).
 1847: 
 1848: collect_lines(S, true) ->
 1849:     collect_lines_1(S, []);
 1850: collect_lines(S, false) ->
 1851:     passive_collect_lines_1(S, []).
 1852: 
 1853: collect_lines_1(S, Acc) ->
 1854:     receive
 1855: 	{tcp,S,Line} ->
 1856:             ?P("collect_lines_1(~w): ~p", [S, Line]),
 1857:             collect_lines_1(S, [Line|Acc]);
 1858: 	{tcp_closed,S} ->
 1859:             ?P("collect_lines_1(~w): tcp_closed", [S]),
 1860:             lists:reverse(Acc)
 1861:     end.
 1862: 
 1863: passive_collect_lines_1(S, Acc) ->
 1864:     case gen_tcp:recv(S, 0) of
 1865: 	{ok,Line} -> passive_collect_lines_1(S, [Line|Acc]);
 1866: 	{error,closed} -> lists:reverse(Acc)
 1867:     end.
 1868: 
 1869: 
 1870: send_lines(S, Lines) ->    
 1871:     lists:foreach(fun(Line) ->
 1872:                           ?P("send_line(~w): ~p", [S, Line]),
 1873: 			  ok = gen_tcp:send(S, Line)
 1874: 		  end, Lines).
 1875: 
 1876: %%%
 1877: %%% Shutdown pending.
 1878: %%%
 1879: 
 1880: shutdown_pending(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1881:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1882:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1883:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1884:                             Addr;
 1885:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1886:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1887:                     end
 1888:            end,
 1889:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_shutdown_pending(Config, Addr) end,
 1890:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1891:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1892: 
 1893: do_shutdown_pending(Config, Addr) ->
 1894:     N = 512*1024+17,
 1895:     ?P("N: ~p", [N]),
 1896:     Data = [<<N:32>>,ones(N),42],
 1897:     {Port, Pid} = a_server(Config, Addr),
 1898:     ?P("try connect to server (port: ~p)", [Port]),
 1899:     S = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{ip, Addr}]) of
 1900:             {ok, Socket} ->
 1901:                 ?P("connected"),
 1902:                 Socket;
 1903:             {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 1904:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 1905:         end,
 1906:     ?P("send"),
 1907:     gen_tcp:send(S, Data),
 1908:     ?P("shutdown(write)"),
 1909:     gen_tcp:shutdown(S, write),
 1910:     ?P("await data message"),
 1911:     case sp_await_data(Pid, S) of
 1912:         N ->
 1913:             ok;
 1914:         InvalidN ->
 1915:             ?P("Invalid message: "
 1916:                "~n   Expected: ~p"
 1917:                "~n   Received: ~p", [N, InvalidN]),
 1918:             ct:fail({unexpected_msg, N, InvalidN})
 1919:     end,
 1920:     ?P("done"),
 1921:     ok.
 1922: 
 1923: sp_await_data(Pid, Sock) ->
 1924:     receive
 1925:         {tcp, Sock, Msg} ->
 1926:             ?P("got tcp (data) message: ~p", [Msg]),
 1927:             list_to_integer(Msg) - 5;
 1928:         {'EXIT', Pid, normal} ->
 1929:             ?P("server exited normal"),
 1930:             sp_await_data(Pid, Sock);
 1931:         Other ->
 1932:             ?P("UNEXPECTED: "
 1933:                "~n   ~p", [Other]),
 1934:             ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
 1935:     end.
 1936: 
 1937:  ones(0) -> [];
 1938:  ones(1) -> [1];
 1939:  ones(N) ->
 1940:      Half = N div 2,
 1941:      Ones = ones(Half),
 1942:      case 2*Half of
 1943: 	 N -> [Ones|Ones];
 1944: 	 _ -> [1,Ones|Ones]
 1945:      end.
 1946: 
 1947: a_server(Config, Addr) ->
 1948:      {ok, L}    = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {exit_on_close,false},{active,false}]),
 1949:      Pid        = spawn_link(fun() -> a_server2(L) end),
 1950:      ok         = gen_tcp:controlling_process(L, Pid),
 1951:      {ok, Port} = inet:port(L),
 1952:      {Port, Pid}.
 1953: 
 1954: a_server2(L) ->
 1955:      {ok,S} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 1956:      do_recv(S, []).
 1957: 
 1958:  do_recv(S, Bs0) ->
 1959:      case gen_tcp:recv(S, 0) of
 1960: 	 {ok,B} ->
 1961: 	     do_recv(S, [Bs0,B]);
 1962: 	 {error,closed} ->
 1963: 	     Bs = list_to_binary(Bs0),
 1964: 	     gen_tcp:send(S, integer_to_list(byte_size(Bs))),
 1965: 	     gen_tcp:close(S)
 1966:      end.
 1967: 
 1968: %%
 1969: %% Test 'show_econnreset' option
 1970: %%
 1971: 
 1972: show_econnreset_active(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1973:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1974:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1975:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1976:                             Addr;
 1977:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1978:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1979:                     end
 1980:            end,
 1981:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_show_econnreset_active(Config, Addr) end,
 1982:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1983:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1984: 
 1985: do_show_econnreset_active(Config, Addr) ->
 1986:     %% First confirm everything works with option turned off.
 1987:     ?P("test with option switched off (default)"),
 1988:     {ok, L0} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 1989:     {ok, Port0} = inet:port(L0),
 1990:     Client0 = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port0,
 1991:                             [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]) of
 1992:                  {ok, CSock0} ->
 1993:                      CSock0;
 1994:                   {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason0} ->
 1995:                       ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason0))
 1996:               end,
 1997:     {ok, S0} = gen_tcp:accept(L0),
 1998:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L0),
 1999:     ok = inet:setopts(Client0, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),
 2000:     ok = gen_tcp:close(Client0),
 2001:     receive
 2002:        {tcp_closed, S0} ->
 2003: 	   ok;
 2004:        Other0 ->
 2005: 	   ct:fail({unexpected, off, closed, Other0})
 2006:     after 1000 ->
 2007: 	ct:fail({timeout, {server, no_tcp_closed}})
 2008:     end,
 2009: 
 2010:     %% Now test with option switched on.
 2011:     %% Note: We are also testing that the show_econnreset option is
 2012:     %% inherited from the listening socket by the accepting socket.
 2013:     ?P("test with option explicitly switched on"),
 2014:     {ok, L1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{show_econnreset, true}, {ip, Addr}]),
 2015:     {ok, Port1} = inet:port(L1),
 2016:     Client1 = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port1,
 2017:                             [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]) of
 2018:                   {ok, CSock1} ->
 2019:                       CSock1;
 2020:                   {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason1} ->
 2021:                       ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason1))
 2022:               end,
 2023:     {ok, S1} = gen_tcp:accept(L1),
 2024:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L1),
 2025:     ok = inet:setopts(Client1, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),
 2026:     ok = gen_tcp:close(Client1),
 2027:     receive
 2028: 	{tcp_error, S1, econnreset} ->
 2029: 	    receive
 2030: 		{tcp_closed, S1} ->
 2031:                     ?P("done"),
 2032: 		    ok;
 2033: 		Other1 ->
 2034:                     ?P("UNEXPECTED (expected closed):"
 2035:                        "~n   ~p", [Other1]),
 2036: 		    ct:fail({unexpected, on, closed, Other1})
 2037: 	    after 1 ->
 2038:                     ?P("UNEXPECTED timeout (expected closed)"),
 2039:                     ct:fail({timeout, {server, no_tcp_closed}})
 2040: 	    end;
 2041: 	Other2 ->
 2042:             ?P("UNEXPECTED (expected error:econnreset):"
 2043:                "~n   ~p", [Other2]),
 2044: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, on, econnreset, Other2})
 2045:     after 1000 ->
 2046:             ?P("UNEXPECTED timeout (expected error:econnreset)"),
 2047:             ct:fail({timeout, {server, no_tcp_error}})
 2048:     end.
 2049: 
 2050: show_econnreset_active_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2051:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 2052:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 2053:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 2054:                             Addr;
 2055:                         {error, Reason} ->
 2056:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 2057:                     end
 2058:            end,
 2059:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_show_econnreset_active_once(Config, Addr) end,
 2060:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 2061:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 2062: 
 2063: do_show_econnreset_active_once(Config, Addr) ->
 2064:     %% Now test using {active, once}
 2065:     {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0,
 2066:                       [{active, false},
 2067:                        {show_econnreset, true},
 2068:                        {ip, Addr}]),
 2069:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(L),
 2070:     Client = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port,
 2071:                            [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]) of
 2072:                  {ok, CSock} ->
 2073:                      CSock;
 2074:                   {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 2075:                       ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 2076:               end,
 2077:     {ok, S} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 2078:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 2079:     ok = inet:setopts(Client, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),
 2080:     ok = gen_tcp:close(Client),
 2081:     ok = ct:sleep(20),
 2082:     ok = receive Msg -> {unexpected_msg, Msg} after 0 -> ok end,
 2083:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{active, once}]),
 2084:     receive
 2085: 	{tcp_error, S, econnreset} ->
 2086: 	    receive
 2087: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 2088: 		    ok;
 2089: 		Other1 ->
 2090: 		    ct:fail({unexpected1, Other1})
 2091: 	    after 1 ->
 2092: 		ct:fail({timeout, {server, no_tcp_closed}})
 2093: 	    end;
 2094: 	Other2 ->
 2095: 	    ct:fail({unexpected2, Other2})
 2096:     after 1000 ->
 2097: 	ct:fail({timeout, {server, no_tcp_error}})
 2098:     end.
 2099: 
 2100: show_econnreset_passive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2101:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 2102:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 2103:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 2104:                             Addr;
 2105:                         {error, Reason} ->
 2106:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 2107:                     end
 2108:            end,
 2109:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_show_econnreset_passive(Config, Addr) end,
 2110:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 2111:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 2112: 
 2113: do_show_econnreset_passive(Config, Addr) ->
 2114:     %% First confirm everything works with option turned off.
 2115:     {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]),
 2116:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(L),
 2117:     Client = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]) of
 2118:                  {ok, CSock} ->
 2119:                      CSock;
 2120:                  {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 2121:                      ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 2122:              end,
 2123:     {ok, S} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 2124:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 2125:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),
 2126:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S),
 2127:     ok = ct:sleep(1),
 2128:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Client, 0),
 2129: 
 2130:     %% Now test with option switched on.
 2131:     {ok, L1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]),
 2132:     {ok, Port1} = inet:port(L1),
 2133:     Client1 =
 2134:         case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port1,
 2135:                       [{active,          false},
 2136:                        {show_econnreset, true},
 2137:                        {ip,              Addr}]) of
 2138:             {ok, CSock1} ->
 2139:                 CSock1;
 2140:             {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason1} ->
 2141:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason1))
 2142:         end,            
 2143:     {ok, S1} = gen_tcp:accept(L1),
 2144:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L1),
 2145:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),
 2146:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S1),
 2147:     ok = ct:sleep(1),
 2148:     {error, econnreset} = gen_tcp:recv(Client1, 0),
 2149:     ?P("done"),
 2150:     ok.
