 8103:     end.
 8104: 
 8105: ok({ok,V}) -> V.
 8106: 
 8107: get_hostname(Name) ->
 8108:     "@"++Host = lists:dropwhile(fun(C) -> C =/= $@ end, atom_to_list(Name)),
 8109:     Host.
 8110: 
 8111: otp_13939(doc) ->
 8112:     ["Check that writing to a remotely closed socket doesn't block forever "
 8113:      "when exit_on_close is false."];
 8114: otp_13939(suite) ->
 8115:     [];
 8116: otp_13939(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8117:     {Pid, Ref} = spawn_opt(
 8118:         fun() ->
 8119:             {ok, Listener} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{exit_on_close, false}]),
 8120:             {ok, Port} = inet:port(Listener),
 8121: 
 8122:             spawn_link(
 8123:                 fun() ->
 8124:                     {ok, Client} = ?CONNECT(Config, "localhost", Port,
 8125:                         [{active, false}]),
 8126:                     ok = gen_tcp:close(Client)
 8127:                 end),
 8128: 
 8129:             {ok, Accepted} = gen_tcp:accept(Listener),
 8130: 
 8131:             ok = gen_tcp:send(Accepted, <<0:(10*1024*1024*8)>>),
 8132: 
 8133:             %% The bug surfaces when there's a delay between the send
 8134:             %% operations; inet:getstat is a red herring.
 8135:             timer:sleep(100),
 8136: 
 8137:             {error, Code} = gen_tcp:send(Accepted, <<0:(10*1024*1024*8)>>),
 8138:             ct:pal("gen_tcp:send returned ~p~n", [Code])
 8139:         end, [link, monitor]),
 8140: 
 8141:     receive
 8142:         {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, normal} ->
 8143:             ok
 8144:     after 1000 ->
 8145:         demonitor(Ref, [flush]),
 8146:         exit(Pid, normal),
 8147:         ct:fail("Server process blocked on send.")
 8148:     end.
 8149: 
 8150: 
 8151: %% No point in running this as the test case with inet_backend = socket
 8152: %% as it tests a bug in the inet driver that cannot reproduced with
 8153: %% inet_backend = socket.
 8154: otp_12242(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8155:     Cond = fun() ->
 8156: 		   case os:type() of
 8157: 		       {win32,_} ->
 8158: 			   %% Even if we set sndbuf and recbuf to small sizes
 8159: 			   %% Windows either happily accepts to send GBytes of
 8160: 			   %% data in no time, so the second send below that
 8161: 			   %% is supposed to time out just succeeds, or the 
 8162: 			   %% first send that is supposed to fill the inet_drv
 8163: 			   %% I/O queue and start waiting for when more data
 8164: 			   %% can be sent instead sends all data but suffers
 8165: 			   %% a send failure that closes the socket.
 8166: 			   {skip, backpressure_broken_on_win32};
 8167: 		       _ ->
 8168: 			   case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 8169: 			       true ->
 8170: 				   {skip, "Not compliant with socket"};
 8171: 			       false ->
 8172: 				   ok
 8173: 			   end
 8174: 		   end
 8175: 	   end,
 8176:     TC = fun() -> do_otp_12242(Config) end,
 8177:     ?TC_TRY(otp_12242, Cond, TC).
 8178: 
 8179: do_otp_12242(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8180:     %% Find the IPv4 address of an up and running interface
 8181:     %% that is not loopback nor pointtopoint
 8182:     {ok, IFList} = inet:getifaddrs(),
 8183:     ?P("IFList "
 8184:        "~n      ~p", [IFList]),
 8185:     case
 8186: 	lists:flatten(
 8187: 	  [lists:filtermap(
 8188: 	     fun ({addr, Addr}) when (tuple_size(Addr) =:= 4) ->
 8189: 		     {true, Addr};
 8190: 		 (_) ->
 8191: 		     false
 8192: 	     end, Opts)
 8193: 	   || {_,Opts} <- IFList,
 8194: 	      case lists:keyfind(flags, 1, Opts) of
 8195: 		  {_,Flags} ->
 8196: 		      lists:member(up, Flags)
 8197: 			  andalso
 8198: 			  lists:member(running, Flags)
 8199: 			  andalso
 8200: 			  not lists:member(loopback, Flags)
 8201: 			  andalso
 8202: 			  not lists:member(pointtopoint, Flags);
 8203: 		  false ->
 8204: 		      false
 8205: 	      end])
 8206:     of
 8207: 	[Addr|_] ->
 8208: 	    otp_12242(Config, Addr);
 8209: 	Other ->
 8210: 	    ?SKIPT({no_external_address, Other})
 8211:     end.
 8212: 
 8213: %%
 8214: otp_12242(Config, Addr) when (tuple_size(Addr) =:= 4) ->
 8215:     ct:timetrap(30000),
 8216:     ?P("Using address ~p", [Addr]),
 8217:     Bufsize  = 16 * 1024,
 8218:     Datasize = 128 * 1024 * 1024, % At least 1 s on GBit interface
 8219:     Blob     = binary:copy(<<$x>>, Datasize),
 8220:     LOpts =
 8221:         [{backlog,   4},
 8222: 	 {reuseaddr, true},
 8223: 	 {ip,        Addr},
 8224:          binary,
 8225: 	 {active,    false},
 8226:          {recbuf,    Bufsize},
 8227: 	 {sndbuf,    Bufsize},
 8228: 	 {buffer,    Bufsize}],
 8229:     COpts =
 8230:         [binary,
 8231: 	 {active,       false},
 8232: 	 {ip,           Addr},
 8233:          {linger,       {true, 1}}, % 1 s
 8234:          {send_timeout, 500},
 8235:          {recbuf,       Bufsize},
 8236: 	 {sndbuf,       Bufsize},
 8237: 	 {buffer,       Bufsize}],
 8238:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 8239:     {ok, ListenerNode} = ?START_NODE(?UNIQ_NODE_NAME, "-pa " ++ Dir),
 8240:     Tester = self(),
 8241:     ?P("create listener"),
 8242:     {Listener, ListenerMRef} =
 8243:         spawn_opt(
 8244:           ListenerNode,
 8245:           fun () ->
 8246: 		  ?P("create listen socket"),
 8247:                   {ok,L}     = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, LOpts),
 8248:                   {ok,LPort} = inet:port(L),
 8249: 		  ?P("inform tester about port number: ~w", [LPort]),
 8250:                   Tester ! {self(), port, LPort},
 8251: 		  ?P("try accept"),
 8252:                   {ok, A}    = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 8253: 		  ?P("accepted - close listen socket"),
 8254:                   ok         = gen_tcp:close(L),
 8255: 		  ?P("await close order"),
 8256:                   receive
 8257:                       {Tester, stop} ->
 8258: 			  ?P("close order received - close accepted socket"),
 8259:                           ok = gen_tcp:close(A)
 8260:                   end
 8261:           end, [link, monitor]),
 8262:     ?P("await listen port"),
 8263:     LPort = receive {Listener,port,P} -> P end,
 8264:     ?P("try connect to ~w", [LPort]),
 8265:     {ok,C} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, LPort, COpts, infinity),
 8266:     ?P("connected - get buffers"),
 8267:     {ok, ReadCOpts} = inet:getopts(C, [recbuf,sndbuf,buffer]),
 8268:     ?P("connected sockets buffers:"
 8269:        "~n      ~p", [ReadCOpts]),
 8270: 
 8271:     otp_12242_2(C, Blob, Datasize),
 8272: 
 8273:     ?P("send listener stop"),
 8274:     Listener ! {Tester, stop},
 8275:     ?P("await listener termination"),
 8276:     wait(ListenerMRef),
 8277:     ?P("stop listener node"),
 8278:     ?STOP_NODE(ListenerNode),
 8279:     ?P("done"),
 8280:     ok.
 8281:     
 8282: 
 8283: otp_12242_2(C, Blob, Datasize) ->
 8284:     %% Fill the buffers
 8285:     ?P("sending ~p bytes", [Datasize]),
 8286:     case gen_tcp:send(C, Blob) of
 8287:         ok ->
 8288:             ?P("sent ~p bytes", [Datasize]),
 8289:             otp_12242_3(C, Blob, Datasize);
 8290:         {error, {timeout, _RestData}} ->
 8291:             %% We filled the buffers and timed out;
 8292:             %% this is probably the socket backend - give up.
 8293:             ok;
 8294:         {error, timeout} ->
 8295:             %% The same as the previous clause
 8296:             ok
 8297:     end,
 8298:     _ = gen_tcp:close(C),
 8299:     ok.
 8300: 
 8301: otp_12242_3(C, Blob, Datasize) ->
 8302:     %% Try to ensure that the close call is in progress
 8303:     %% before the owner proceeds with sending
 8304:     CloserMRef = otp_12242_closer(C),
 8305:     
 8306:     ?P("await tref"),
 8307:     receive
 8308:         {tref,Tref} ->
 8309: 	    ?P("tref received - now await trigger timeout"),
 8310:             receive {timeout,Tref,_} -> ok end,
 8311:             ?P("trigger timeout received - try send ~p bytes again",
 8312: 	       [Datasize]),
 8313:             %% Now should the close be in progress...
 8314:             %% All buffers are full, remote end is not reading,
 8315:             %% and the send timeout is 1 s so this will timeout:
 8316:             {error, timeout} = gen_tcp:send(C, Blob),
 8317:             ?P("expected timeout - update send_timeout (to 10000)"),
 8318:             ok = inet:setopts(C, [{send_timeout, 10000}]),
 8319:             %% There is a hidden timeout here.  Port close is sampled
 8320:             %% every 5 s by prim_inet:send_recv_reply.
 8321:             %% Linger is 3 s so the Closer will finish this send:
 8322:             ?P("try send ~p bytes - expect error (closed)", [Datasize]),
 8323:             {error, closed} = gen_tcp:send(C, Blob),
 8324:             ?P("await closer termination"),
 8325:             normal = wait(CloserMRef),
 8326:             ok
 8327:     end.
 8328: 
 8329: otp_12242_closer(C) ->
 8330:     Owner = self(),
 8331:     {_Closer, CloserMref} =
 8332:         spawn_opt(
 8333:           fun () ->
 8334:                   ?P("[closer] starting"),
 8335:                   Owner ! {tref, erlang:start_timer(50, Owner, closing)},
 8336:                   ?P("[closer] calling gen_tcp:close(C)"),
 8337:                   try gen_tcp:close(C) of
 8338:                       Result ->
 8339:                           ?P("[closer] gen_tcp:close(C) -> ~p", [Result]),
 8340:                           ok = Result
 8341:                   catch
 8342:                       Class:Reason:Stacktrace ->
 8343:                           ?P("[closer] caught gen_tcp:close(C):"
 8344: 			     "~n      Error Class:  ~p"
 8345: 			     "~n      Error:        ~p"
 8346: 			     "~n      Stack trace:  ~p",
 8347:                             [Class, Reason, Stacktrace]),
 8348:                           erlang:raise(Class, Reason, Stacktrace)
 8349:                   end
 8350:           end, [link, monitor]),
 8351:     CloserMref.
 8352: 
 8353: 
 8354: wait(Mref) ->
 8355:     receive {'DOWN',Mref,_,_,Reason} -> Reason end.
 8356: 
 8357: %% OTP-15536
 8358: %% Test that send error works correctly for delay_send
 8359: delay_send_error(Config) ->
 8360:     ?P("create listen socket"),
 8361:     {ok, Addr} = ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet),
 8362:     {ok, L}    = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip,        Addr},
 8363:                                      {reuseaddr, true},
 8364:                                      {packet,    1},
 8365:                                      {active,    false}]),
 8366:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(L),
 8367: 
 8368:     delay_send_error(Config, L, Addr, PortNum, false),
 8369:     delay_send_error(Config, L, Addr, PortNum, true),
 8370:     ?P("close listen socket"),
 8371:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L).
 8372: 
 8373: delay_send_error(Config, L, Addr, PortNum, Active) ->
 8374:     ?P("try connect - with delay_send:true active:~p",[Active]),
 8375:     {ok, C} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum,
 8376:                        [{ip,         Addr},
 8377:                         {packet,     1},
 8378:                         {active,     Active},
 8379:                         {delay_send, true}]),
 8380:     ?P("try accept"),
 8381:     {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 8382:     %% Do a couple of sends first to see that it works
 8383:     ?P("send data"),
 8384:     ok = gen_tcp:send(C, "hello"),
 8385:     ?P("send data"),
 8386:     ok = gen_tcp:send(C, "hello"),
 8387:     ?P("send data"),
 8388:     ok = gen_tcp:send(C, "hello"),
 8389:     %% Close the receiver
 8390:     ?P("close receiver (accepted socket)"),
 8391:     ok = gen_tcp:shutdown(C, write),
 8392:     %%
 8393:     ?P("send data"),
 8394:     case gen_tcp:send(C, "hello") of
 8395:         ok ->
 8396:             ?P("send data"),
 8397:             case gen_tcp:send(C, "hello") of
 8398:                 ok ->
 8399:                     delay_send_error2(C);
 8400:                 {error, closed} ->
 8401:                     ?P("closed (expected)"),
 8402:                     ok
 8403:             end;
 8404: 
 8405:         {error, closed} ->
 8406:             ?P("closed (expected)"),
 8407:             ok;
 8408: 
 8409:         {error, #{info := eshutdown = R}} ->
 8410:             ?P("~w (expected)", [R]),
 8411:             ok;
 8412:         {error, eshutdown = R} ->
 8413:             ?P("~w (expected)", [R]),
 8414:             ok
 8415:     end,
 8416:     ?P("close accepted socket"),
 8417:     ok = gen_tcp:close(A),
 8418:     ?P("close connected socket"),
 8419:     ok = gen_tcp:close(C).
 8420: 
 8421: 
 8422: delay_send_error2(Sock) ->
 8423:     delay_send_error2(Sock, 3).
 8424: 
 8425: delay_send_error2(Sock, 0) ->
 8426:     gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 8427:     ct:fail("Unexpected send success");
 8428: delay_send_error2(Sock, N) ->
 8429:     %% Sleep in order for delay_send to have time to trigger
 8430:     %% This used to result in a double free
 8431:     timer:sleep(1000),
 8432:     case gen_tcp:send(Sock, "hello") of
 8433:         ok ->
 8434:             delay_send_error2(Sock, N-1);
 8435:         {error, closed} ->
 8436:             ?P("closed (expected, ~w)", [N]),
 8437:             ok;
 8438:         {error, Reason} ->
 8439:             ct:fail(?F("Unexpected send error: ~p", [Reason]))
 8440:     end.
 8441: 
 8442:     
 8443: 
 8444: 
 8445: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8446: 
 8447: 
 8448: -define(MAX_WORKERS, 30).
 8449: 
 8450: %% 30-second test for gen_tcp in {active, N} mode,
 8451: %% ensuring it does not get stuck.
 8452: %% Verifies that erl_check_io properly handles extra EPOLLIN signals.
 8453: %% We do not bother with this test case on inet_backend = socket
 8454: %% since the test is about the inet-driver!
 8455: bidirectional_traffic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8456:     ct:timetrap(?SECS(30)),
 8457:     Cond = fun() ->
 8458: 		   case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 8459: 		       true ->
 8460: 			   {skip, "Inet driver specific test"};
 8461: 		       false ->
 8462: 			   ok
 8463: 		   end
 8464: 	   end,
 8465:     Pre  = fun() ->
 8466: 		   Addr =
 8467: 		       case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8468: 			   {ok, A} ->
 8469: 			       A;
 8470: 			   {error, Reason} ->
 8471: 			       ?SKIPT({skip, Reason})
 8472: 		       end,
 8473:                    NumOnlineScheds = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 8474:                    NumWorkers0     = NumOnlineScheds * 2,
 8475:                    {NumWorkers, ActiveN} =
 8476:                        if
 8477:                            (NumWorkers0 =< 10) ->
 8478:                                {NumWorkers0, 20};
 8479:                            (NumWorkers0 =< 20) ->
 8480:                                {NumWorkers0, 18};
 8481:                            (NumWorkers0 =< ?MAX_WORKERS) ->
 8482:                                {NumWorkers0, 15};
 8483:                            true ->
 8484:                                {?MAX_WORKERS, 15}
 8485:                        end,
 8486:                    ?P("pre ->"
 8487:                       "~n   Number Of Online Schedulers: ~w"
 8488:                       "~n   =>"
 8489:                       "~n      Use workers: ~w"
 8490:                       "~n      ActiveN:     ~w",
 8491:                       [NumOnlineScheds, NumWorkers, ActiveN]),
 8492:                    Payload = bdt_payload(32),
 8493:                    {ok, LSock} = ?LISTEN(Config,
 8494:                                          0,
 8495:                                          [binary,
 8496:                                           {ip,        Addr},
 8497: 					  {packet,    0},
 8498:                                           {active,    false},
 8499:                                           {reuseaddr, true}]),
 8500:                    %% get all sockets to know failing ends
 8501:                    ?P("pre -> listen socket created: "
 8502:                       "~n      ~p", [LSock]),
 8503:                    #{lsock       => LSock,
 8504: 		     addr        => Addr,
 8505:                      num_workers => NumWorkers,
 8506:                      payload     => Payload,
 8507:                      %% The point of this is to make it "easy" to 
 8508:                      %% "configure" this value...
 8509:                      active_n    => ActiveN}
 8510:            end,
 8511:     Case = fun(Info) -> do_bidirectional_traffic(Config, Info) end,
 8512:     Post = fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
 8513:                    ?P("post -> close listen socket"),
 8514:                    (catch gen_tcp:close(LSock))
 8515:            end,
 8516:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 8517:             Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 8518: 
 8519: bdt_payload(N) ->
 8520:     rand:bytes(N).
 8521:     
 8522: 
 8523: do_bidirectional_traffic(Config, #{lsock       := LSock,
 8524:                                    num_workers := NumWorkers} = Info) ->
 8525:     ?P("case -> begin"),
 8526:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(LSock),
 8527:     ?P("case -> listen socket port number ~w", [Port]),
 8528:     Control = self(),
 8529:     ?P("case -> create ~w receivers", [NumWorkers]),
 8530:     Receivers = [spawn_link(fun () -> 
 8531: 				    exchange(Config,
 8532:                                              Info#{port => Port,
 8533:                                                    ctrl => Control})
 8534: 			    end) || _ <- lists:seq(1, NumWorkers)],
 8535:     ?P("case -> await the result"),
 8536:     %% Should we not collect as many as possible?
 8537:     %% To see how many as issues?
 8538:     Result =
 8539: 	%% If any of the receivers report, we have an error
 8540:         receive
 8541:             {timeout, Socket, Total} ->
 8542:                 ?P("case -> timeout msg for ~p: received ~w", [Socket, Total]),
 8543:                 {fail, {timeout, Socket, Total}};
 8544: 	    {error, Socket, Reason} ->
 8545:                 ?P("case -> error msg for ~p: ~p", [Socket, Reason]),
 8546:                 {fail, {error, Socket, Reason}}
 8547:         after 30000 ->
 8548:                 %% if it does not fail in 30 seconds, it most likely works
 8549:                 ?P("case -> timeout => success"),
 8550:                 ok
 8551:         end,
 8552:     ?P("case -> ensure all receivers terminated"),
 8553:     %% [begin unlink(Rec), exit(Rec, kill) end || Rec <- Receivers],
 8554:     bt_terminate_receivers(Receivers),
 8555:     ?P("case -> done"),
 8556:     Result.
 8557: 
 8558: %% The point of this (function) is so that the 'receivers' should
 8559: %% get a chance to "tell us" what they are up to...
 8560: bt_terminate_receivers(Recvs) ->
 8561:     bt_terminate_receivers_nice(Recvs),
 8562:     ?SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 8563:     bt_terminate_receivers_force(Recvs).
 8564: 
 8565: bt_terminate_receivers_nice(Recvs) ->
 8566:     [begin
 8567:          unlink(Recv),
 8568:          Recv ! terminate
 8569:      end || Recv <- Recvs].
 8570: 
 8571: bt_terminate_receivers_force(Recvs) ->
 8572:     [exit(Recv, kill) || Recv <- Recvs].
 8573:     
 8574: exchange(Config, #{lsock    := LSock,
 8575: 		   addr     := Addr,
 8576:                    port     := Port, 
 8577:                    payload  := Payload,
 8578:                    ctrl     := Control,
 8579:                    active_n := ActiveN}) ->
 8580:     %% spin up client
 8581:     _ClntRcv = spawn_link(
 8582:         fun () ->
 8583:                 ?P("exchange:client -> connect"),
 8584:                 {ok, Client} =
 8585:                     ?CONNECT(Config,
 8586: 			     Addr,
 8587: 			     Port,
 8588: 			     [binary,
 8589: 			      {ip, Addr}, {packet, 0}, {active, ActiveN}]),
 8590:                 ?P("exchange:client -> connected: ~p"
 8591:                    "~n      PeerName: ~p"
 8592:                    "~n      SockName: ~p",
 8593:                    [Client,
 8594:                     oki(inet:peername(Client)), oki(inet:sockname(Client))]),
 8595:                 put(role, connected),
 8596:                 send_recv_loop(Client, Payload, Control, ActiveN)
 8597:         end),
 8598:     ?P("exchange -> accept"),
 8599:     {ok, Socket} = gen_tcp:accept(LSock),
 8600:     ?P("exchange -> accepted: ~p"
 8601:        "~n      PeerName: ~p"
 8602:        "~n      SockName: ~p",
 8603:        [Socket, oki(inet:peername(Socket)), oki(inet:sockname(Socket))]),
 8604:     %% sending process
 8605:     put(role, accepted),
 8606:     send_recv_loop(Socket, Payload, Control, ActiveN).
 8607: 
 8608: send_recv_loop(Socket, Payload, Control, ActiveN) ->
 8609:     %% {active, N} must be set to active > 12 to trigger the issue
 8610:     %% {active, 30} seems to trigger it quite often & reliably
 8611:     Role = get(role),
 8612:     ?P("[~w] set (initial) active: ~p", [Role, ActiveN]),
 8613:     inet:setopts(Socket, [{active, ActiveN}]),
 8614:     ?P("[~w] spawn sender", [Role]),
 8615:     _Snd = spawn_link(
 8616:         fun Sender() ->
 8617:             case gen_tcp:send(Socket, Payload) of
 8618:                 ok ->
 8619:                     Sender();
 8620:                 {error, closed} ->
 8621:                     ?P("[~w,sender] Socket closed", [Role]),
 8622:                     exit(normal);
 8623:                 {error, Reason} ->
 8624:                     ?P("[~w,sender] Send failed: "
 8625:                        "~n      ~p", [Role, Reason]),
 8626:                     exit({send_failed, Reason})
 8627:             end
 8628:         end),
 8629:     ?P("[~w] begin recv", [Role]),
 8630:     recv(Socket, 0, 0, 0, Control, ActiveN).
 8631: 
 8632: recv(Socket, Total, TotIter, TotAct, Control, ActiveN) ->
 8633:     receive
 8634:         terminate ->
 8635:             ?P("[~w,recv] received terminate message when"
 8636:                "~n      Total received:    ~w"
 8637:                "~n      Total iterations:  ~w"
 8638:                "~n      Total activations: ~w"
 8639:                "~n      Socket:            ~p"
 8640:                "~n      Socket Info:       ~p",
 8641:                [get(role),
 8642:                 Total, TotIter, TotAct,
 8643:                 Socket, (catch inet:info(Socket))]),
 8644:             (catch gen_tcp:close(Socket)),
 8645:             exit(normal);
 8646: 
 8647:         {tcp, Socket, Data} ->
 8648:             recv(Socket,
 8649:                  Total + byte_size(Data), TotIter + 1, TotAct,
 8650:                  Control, ActiveN);
 8651:         {tcp_passive, Socket} ->
 8652:             inet:setopts(Socket, [{active, ActiveN}]),
 8653:             recv(Socket, Total, TotIter, TotAct + 1, Control, ActiveN);
 8654:         {tcp_closed, Socket} ->
 8655:             ?P("[~w,recv] closed when"
 8656:                "~n      Total received:    ~w"
 8657:                "~n      Total iterations:  ~w"
 8658:                "~n      Total activations: ~w"
 8659:                "~n      Socket Info:       ~p",
 8660: 	       [get(role), Total, TotIter, TotAct, (catch inet:info(Socket))]),
 8661: 	    ok;
 8662: 
 8663:         Other ->
 8664:             ?P("[~w,recv] received unexpected message"
 8665:                "~n      Msg:               ~p"
 8666:                "~n   when:"
 8667:                "~n      Total received:    ~w"
 8668:                "~n      Total iterations:  ~w"
 8669:                "~n      Total activations: ~w"
 8670:                "~n      Socket:            ~p"
 8671:                "~n      PeerName:          ~p"
 8672:                "~n      SockName:          ~p"
 8673:                "~n      Socket Info:       ~p",
 8674:                [get(role),
 8675:                 Other,
 8676:                 Total, TotIter, TotAct,
 8677:                 Socket, oki(inet:peername(Socket)), oki(inet:sockname(Socket)),
 8678:                 (catch inet:info(Socket))]),
 8679:             (catch gen_tcp:close(Socket)),
 8680:             Control ! {error, Socket, Other}
 8681: 
 8682:     after 2000 ->
 8683:             %% no data received in 2 seconds => test failed
 8684:             ?P("[~w,recv timeout] received nothing when:"
 8685:                "~n      Total received:    ~w"
 8686:                "~n      Total iterations:  ~w"
 8687:                "~n      Total activations: ~w"
 8688:                "~n      Socket:            ~p"
 8689:                "~n      PeerName:          ~p"
 8690:                "~n      SockName:          ~p"
 8691:                "~n      Socket Info:       ~p",
 8692:                [get(role),
 8693:                 Total, TotIter, TotAct,
 8694:                 Socket, oki(inet:peername(Socket)), oki(inet:sockname(Socket)),
 8695:                 (catch inet:info(Socket))]),
 8696:             (catch gen_tcp:close(Socket)),
 8697:             Control ! {timeout, Socket, Total}
 8698:     end.
 8699: 
 8700: 
 8701: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8702: 
 8703: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 8704: %% We create a listen socket, then spawns processes that create
 8705: %% monitors to it...
 8706: socket_monitor1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8707:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 8708:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 8709:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8710:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 8711:                             Addr;
 8712:                         {error, Reason} ->
 8713:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 8714:                     end
 8715:            end,
 8716:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor1(Config, Addr) end,
 8717:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 8718:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 8719: 
 8720: do_socket_monitor1(Config, Addr) ->
 8721:     ?P("begin"),
 8722:     Self         = self(),
 8723:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 8724:     {ok, LSock1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8725:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 8726:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 8727: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 8728: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 8729: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 8730: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 8731: 	 end,
 8732:     ?P("spawn client"),
 8733:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSock1, F1),
 8734:     ?P("await client ready"),
 8735:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 8736:     ?P("close socket"),
 8737:     gen_tcp:close(LSock1),
 8738:     ?P("await client termination"),
 8739:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 8740:     ?P("done"),
 8741:     ok.
 8742: 
 8743: sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType) ->
 8744:     sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, "client").
 8745: 
 8746: sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, Name) ->
 8747:     receive
 8748: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) andalso 
 8749: 					     (Mon  =:= ExpMon)  andalso 
 8750: 					     (Sock =:= ExpSock) ->
 8751: 	    ?P("[~s] received expected (socket) down message: "
 8752: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 8753: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 8754: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 8755: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 8756: 	    exit(ok);
 8757: 
 8758: 	Any ->
 8759: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected message: "
 8760: 	       "~n   ~p", [Name, Any]),
 8761: 	    exit({unexpected_message, Any})
 8762:     end.
 8763: 
 8764: sm_await_client_ready(Pid) ->
 8765:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid, "client").
 8766: 
 8767: sm_await_client_ready(Pid, Name) ->
 8768:     receive
 8769: 	{Pid, ready} ->
 8770: 	    ?P("received ~s ready", [Name])
 8771:     end.
 8772: 
 8773: sm_await_down(Pid, Mon, ExpRes) ->
 8774:     receive
 8775: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, ExpRes} ->
 8776: 	    ?P("received expected process down message from ~p", [Pid]),
 8777: 	    ok;
 8778: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, UnexpRes} ->
 8779: 	    ?P("received unexpected process down message from ~p: "
 8780: 	       "~n   ~p", [Pid, UnexpRes]),
 8781: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_down, UnexpRes})
 8782:     end.
 8783: 
 8784: 
 8785: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8786: 
 8787: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 8788: %% We create "many" listen socket(s), then spawns processes that create
 8789: %% monitors to them...
 8790: socket_monitor1_manys(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8791:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 8792:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 8793:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8794:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 8795:                             Addr;
 8796:                         {error, Reason} ->
 8797:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 8798:                     end
 8799:            end,
 8800:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor1_manys(Config, Addr) end,
 8801:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 8802:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 8803: 
 8804: do_socket_monitor1_manys(Config, Addr) ->
 8805:     ?P("begin"),
 8806:     Self         = self(),
 8807:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 8808:     ?P("[client] create socket(s)"),
 8809:     {ok, LSock1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8810:     {ok, LSock2} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8811:     {ok, LSock3} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8812:     {ok, LSock4} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8813:     {ok, LSock5} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8814:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 8815:     F1 = fun(Sockets, Parent) when is_list(Sockets) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 8816: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor(s)"),
 8817: 		 Monitors = [{inet:monitor(Socket), Socket} ||
 8818: 				Socket <- Sockets],
 8819: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 8820: 		 sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, Type)
 8821: 	 end,
 8822:     ?P("spawn client"),
 8823:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F([LSock1, LSock2, LSock3, LSock4, LSock5], F1),
 8824:     ?P("await client ready"),
 8825:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 8826:     ?P("close socket(s)"),
 8827:     gen_tcp:close(LSock1),
 8828:     gen_tcp:close(LSock2),
 8829:     gen_tcp:close(LSock3),
 8830:     gen_tcp:close(LSock4),
 8831:     gen_tcp:close(LSock5),
 8832:     ?P("await client termination"),
 8833:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 8834:     ?P("done"),
 8835:     ok.
 8836: 
 8837: 
 8838: sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, ExpType) ->
 8839:     sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, ExpType, "client").
 8840: 
 8841: sm_await_socket_down2([], _ExpType, Name) ->
 8842:     ?P("[~s] all sockets down", [Name]),
 8843:     exit(ok);
 8844: sm_await_socket_down2(Mons, ExpType, Name) when is_list(Mons) ->
 8845:     ?P("[~s] await socket down", [Name]),
 8846:     receive
 8847: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) ->
 8848: 	    ?P("[~s] received expected (socket) down message: "
 8849: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 8850: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 8851: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 8852: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 8853: 	    case lists:keysearch(Mon, 1, Mons) of
 8854: 		{value, {Mon, Sock}} ->
 8855: 		    Mons2 = lists:keydelete(Mon, 1, Mons),
 8856: 		    sm_await_socket_down2(Mons2, ExpType, Name);
 8857: 		{value, Value} ->
 8858: 		    ?P("[~s] Unexpected socket down: "
 8859: 		       "~n   Value: ~p", [Name, Value]),
 8860: 		    ct:fail({unexpected_monitor, Mon, Value});
 8861: 		false ->
 8862: 		    ct:fail({unknown_monitor, Mon})
 8863: 	    end
 8864:     end.
 8865: 
 8866: 
 8867: 
 8868: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8869: 
 8870: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 8871: %% We create a listen socket, then spawn client process(es) that create
 8872: %% monitors to it...
 8873: socket_monitor1_manyc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8874:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 8875:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 8876:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8877:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 8878:                             Addr;
 8879:                         {error, Reason} ->
 8880:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 8881:                     end
 8882:            end,
 8883:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor1_manyc(Config, Addr) end,
 8884:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 8885:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 8886: 
 8887: do_socket_monitor1_manyc(Config, Addr) ->
 8888:     ?P("begin"),
 8889:     Self         = self(),
 8890:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 8891:     {ok, LSock1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8892:     F  = fun(S, Fun, Name) ->
 8893: 		 spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Name, Self) end)
 8894: 	 end,
 8895:     F1 = fun(Socket, Name, Parent) when is_list(Name) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 8896: 		 ?P("[~s] monitor socket", [Name]),
 8897: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 8898: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 8899: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 8900: 	 end,
 8901:     ?P("spawn client(s)"),
 8902:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSock1, F1, "client1"),
 8903:     {Pid2, Mon2} = F(LSock1, F1, "client2"),
 8904:     {Pid3, Mon3} = F(LSock1, F1, "client3"),
 8905:     {Pid4, Mon4} = F(LSock1, F1, "client4"),
 8906:     {Pid5, Mon5} = F(LSock1, F1, "client5"),
 8907:     ?P("await client(s) ready"),
 8908:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1, "client1"),
 8909:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid2, "client2"),
 8910:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid3, "client3"),
 8911:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid4, "client4"),
 8912:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid5, "client5"),
 8913:     ?P("close socket"),
 8914:     gen_tcp:close(LSock1),
 8915:     ?P("await client(s) termination"),
 8916:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 8917:     sm_await_down(Pid2, Mon2, ok),
 8918:     sm_await_down(Pid3, Mon3, ok),
 8919:     sm_await_down(Pid4, Mon4, ok),
 8920:     sm_await_down(Pid5, Mon5, ok),
 8921:     ?P("done"),
 8922:     ok.
 8923:

 8925: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8926: 
 8927: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 8928: %% We create a listen socket, then spawns processes that create
 8929: %% monitors to it...
 8930: socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8931:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 8932:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 8933:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8934:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 8935:                             Addr;
 8936:                         {error, Reason} ->
 8937:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 8938:                     end
 8939:            end,
 8940:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config, Addr) end,
 8941:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 8942:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 8943: 
 8944: do_socket_monitor1_demon_after(Config, Addr) ->
 8945:     ?P("begin"),
 8946:     Self         = self(),
 8947:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 8948:     {ok, LSock1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8949:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 8950:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 8951: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 8952: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 8953: 		 ?P("[client] sleep some"),
 8954: 		 ?SLEEP(?SECS(1)),
 8955: 		 ?P("[client] cancel (socket) monitor"),
 8956: 		 inet:cancel_monitor(MRef),
 8957: 		 ?P("[client] announce ready"),
 8958: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 8959: 		 sm_await_no_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 8960: 	 end,
 8961:     ?P("spawn client"),
 8962:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSock1, F1),
 8963:     ?P("await client ready"),
 8964:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 8965:     ?P("close socket"),
 8966:     gen_tcp:close(LSock1),
 8967:     ?P("await client termination"),
 8968:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 8969:     ?P("done"),
 8970:     ok.
 8971: 
 8972: 
 8973: sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType) ->
 8974:     sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, "client").
 8975: 
 8976: sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, Name) ->
 8977:     receive
 8978: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) andalso 
 8979: 					     (Mon  =:= ExpMon)  andalso 
 8980: 					     (Sock =:= ExpSock) ->
 8981: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected (socket) down message: "
 8982: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 8983: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 8984: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 8985: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 8986: 	    exit({unexpected_down, Mon, Type, Sock, Info});
 8987: 
 8988: 	Any ->
 8989: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected message: "
 8990: 	       "~n   ~p", [Name, Any]),
 8991: 	    exit({unexpected_message, Any})
 8992: 
 8993:     after 1000 ->
 8994: 	    ?P("[~s] expected message timeout", [Name]),
 8995: 	    exit(ok)
 8996:     end.
 8997:

 8999: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9000: 
 9001: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 9002: %% Spawn a process that creates a (listen) socket, then spawns processes
 9003: %% that create monitors to it...
 9004: socket_monitor2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9005:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 9006:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 9007:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 9008:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 9009:                             Addr;
 9010:                         {error, Reason} ->
 9011:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 9012:                     end
 9013:            end,
 9014:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor2(Config, Addr) end,
 9015:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9016:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 9017: 
 9018: do_socket_monitor2(Config, Addr) ->
 9019:     ?P("begin"),
 9020:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 9021:     Self         = self(),
 9022:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 9023: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 9024: 			      ?P("[owner] create (listen) socket"),
 9025: 			      {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9026: 			      ?P("[owner] send (listen) socket to ctrl"),
 9027: 			      Self ! {socket, L},
 9028: 			      ?P("[owner] ready"),
 9029: 			      receive
 9030: 				  {Self, die} ->
 9031: 				      exit(normal)
 9032: 			      end
 9033: 		      end),
 9034:     LSock1 = receive
 9035: 		 {socket, L} ->
 9036: 		     ?P("received socket from owner"),
 9037: 		     L;
 9038: 		 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 9039: 		     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 9040: 			"~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 9041: 		     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 9042: 	     end,
 9043:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 9044:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 9045: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 9046: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 9047: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 9048: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 9049: 	 end,
 9050:     ?P("spawn client"),
 9051:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSock1, F1),
 9052:     ?P("spawn client"),
 9053:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 9054:     ?P("kill owner"),
 9055:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 9056:     ?P("await owner termination"),
 9057:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 9058:     ?P("await client termination"),
 9059:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 9060:     ?P("done"),
 9061:     ok.

 9070: socket_monitor2_manys(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9071:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 9072:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 9073:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 9074:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 9075:                             Addr;
 9076:                         {error, Reason} ->
 9077:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 9078:                     end
 9079:            end,
 9080:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor2_manys(Config, Addr) end,
 9081:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9082:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 9083: 
 9084: do_socket_monitor2_manys(Config, Addr) ->
 9085:     ?P("begin"),
 9086:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 9087:     Self         = self(),
 9088:     ?P("spawn owner"),
 9089:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 9090: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 9091: 			      ?P("[owner] create (listen) socket(s)"),
 9092: 			      {ok, L1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9093: 			      {ok, L2} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9094: 			      {ok, L3} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9095: 			      {ok, L4} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9096: 			      {ok, L5} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9097: 			      ?P("[owner] send (listen) socket(s) to ctrl"),
 9098: 			      Self ! {socket, [L1, L2, L3, L4, L5]},
 9099: 			      ?P("[owner] ready"),
 9100: 			      receive
 9101: 				  {Self, die} ->
 9102: 				      exit(normal)
 9103: 			      end
 9104: 		      end),
 9105:     ?P("await sockets (from owner)"),
 9106:     LSocks = receive
 9107: 		 {socket, Socks} ->
 9108: 		     ?P("received socket(s) from owner"),
 9109: 		     Socks;
 9110: 		 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 9111: 		     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 9112: 			"~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 9113: 		     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 9114: 	     end,
 9115:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 9116:     F1 = fun(Sockets, Parent) when is_list(Sockets) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 9117: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor(s)"),
 9118: 		 Monitors = [{inet:monitor(Socket), Socket} ||
 9119: 				Socket <- Sockets],
 9120: 		 ?P("[client] announce ready"),
 9121: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 9122: 		 sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, Type)
 9123: 	 end,
 9124:     ?P("spawn client"),
 9125:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSocks, F1),
 9126:     ?P("await client ready"),
 9127:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 9128:     ?P("kill owner"),
 9129:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 9130:     ?P("await owner (~p) termination", [OwnerPid]),
 9131:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 9132:     ?P("await client termination"),
 9133:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 9134:     ?P("done"),
 9135:     ok.

 9216: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 9217: %% Spawn a process that creates a (listen) socket, then spawns (client)
 9218: %% processes that create monitors to it...
 9219: otp_17492(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9220:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 9221:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 9222:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 9223:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 9224:                             Addr;
 9225:                         {error, Reason} ->
 9226:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 9227:                     end
 9228:            end,
 9229:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_otp_17492(Config, Addr) end,
 9230:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9231:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 9232: 
 9233: do_otp_17492(Config, Addr) ->
 9234:     ?P("begin"),
 9235: 
 9236:     Self = self(),
 9237: 
 9238:     ?P("try create listen socket"),
 9239:     {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9240: 
 9241:     ?P("try get (created) listen socket info"),
 9242:     try inet:info(L) of
 9243: 	#{owner := Owner} = Info when is_pid(Owner) andalso (Owner =:= Self) ->
 9244: 	    ?P("(created) Listen socket info: ~p", [Info]);
 9245: 	OBadInfo ->
 9246: 	    ?P("(created) listen socket info: ~p", [OBadInfo]),
 9247: 	    (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9248: 	    ct:fail({invalid_created_info, OBadInfo})
 9249:     catch
 9250: 	OC:OE:OS ->
 9251: 	    ?P("Failed get (created) listen socket info: "
 9252: 	       "~n   Class: ~p"
 9253: 	       "~n   Error: ~p"
 9254: 	       "~n   Stack: ~p", [OC, OE, OS]),
 9255: 	    (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9256: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_created_info_result, {OC, OE, OS}})
 9257:     end,
 9258: 
 9259:     ?P("try close (listen) socket"),
 9260:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 9261: 
 9262:     ?P("try get (closed) listen socket info"),
 9263:     try inet:info(L) of
 9264: 	#{states := [closed]} = CInfo when is_port(L) ->
 9265: 	    ?P("(closed) listen socket info: "
 9266: 	       "~n   ~p", [CInfo]);
 9267: 	#{rstates := [closed], wstates := [closed]} = CInfo ->
 9268: 	    ?P("(closed) listen socket info: "
 9269: 	       "~n   ~p", [CInfo]);
 9270: 	CBadInfo ->
 9271: 	    ?P("(closed) listen socket info: ~p", [CBadInfo]),
 9272: 	    ct:fail({invalid_closed_info, CBadInfo})
 9273:     catch
 9274: 	CC:CE:CS ->
 9275: 	    ?P("Failed get (closed) listen socket info: "
 9276: 	       "~n   Class: ~p"
 9277: 	       "~n   Error: ~p"
 9278: 	       "~n   Stack: ~p", [CC, CE, CS]),
 9279: 	    (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9280: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_closed_info_result, {CC, CE, CS}})
 9281:     end,
 9282: 
 9283:     ?P("done"),
 9284:     ok.

 9287: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9288: 
 9289: %% Check that we can connect with the option 'bind_to_device'
 9290: %% and the inet_backend option set to socket.
 9291: %% The value types *where* mutually exclusive:
 9292: %% prim_inet: binary()
 9293: %% socket:    string()
 9294: otp_18357(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9295:     ct:timetrap(?SECS(30)),
 9296:     Cond = fun() ->
 9297:                    is_socket_supported(),
 9298:                    has_support_sock_bindtodevice()
 9299:            end,
 9300:     Pre  = fun() ->
 9301:                    case ?LIB:which_local_host_info(inet) of
 9302:                        {ok, [#{name := Name, addr := Addr}|_]} ->
 9303:                            ?P("~w:pre -> local host info:"
 9304:                               "~n   (IF) Name: ~p"
 9305:                               "~n   (IF) Addr: ~p",
 9306:                               [?FUNCTION_NAME, Name, Addr]),
 9307:                            #{name => Name, addr => Addr};
 9308:                        {error, Reason} ->
 9309:                            {skip, ?F("Failed get local address: ~p", [Reason])}
 9310:                    end
 9311:            end,
 9312:     Case = fun(State) -> do_otp_18357(State) end,
 9313:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9314:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 9315: 
 9316: do_otp_18357(#{name := Name, addr := Addr}) ->
 9317:     ?P("try create listen socket"),
 9318:     {ok, L}      = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{ifaddr, Addr}]),
 9319:     {ok, PortNo} = inet:port(L),
 9320: 
 9321:     ?P("try connect (with bind-to-device)"),
 9322:     C = case gen_tcp:connect(Addr, PortNo,
 9323:                              [{inet_backend,   socket},
 9324:                               {bind_to_device, list_to_binary(Name)}]) of
 9325:             {ok, CSock} ->
 9326:                 CSock;
 9327:             {error, eperm = Reason} ->
 9328:                 ?P("Failed connecting, ~p, skipping", [Reason]),
 9329:                 (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9330:                 skip(Reason)
 9331:         end,
 9332: 
 9333:     ?P("try accept"),
 9334:     {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 9335: 
 9336:     ?P("cleanup"),
 9337:     (catch gen_tcp:close(C)),
 9338:     (catch gen_tcp:close(A)),
 9339:     (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9340: 
 9341:     ?P("done"),
 9342:     ok.

 9383: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 9384: otp_18707(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9385:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 9386:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 9387:             fun() ->
 9388:                     %% We are not actually trying to make a connection...
 9389:                     is_socket_supported(),
 9390:                     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
 9391:                         true ->
 9392:                             case ?WHICH_INET_BACKEND(Config) of
 9393:                                 socket ->
 9394:                                     ok;
 9395:                                 Backend ->
 9396:                                     ?SKIPT({backend, Backend})
 9397:                             end;
 9398:                         _ ->
 9399:                             ok
 9400:                     end
 9401:             end,
 9402:             fun() -> do_otp_18707(Config) end).
 9403: 
 9404: do_otp_18707(_Config) ->
 9405:     ?P("begin"),
 9406: 
 9407:     try gen_tcp:connect(#{port   => 80,
 9408:                           addr   => {127, 0, 0, 1},
 9409:                           family => inet},
 9410:                         [{inet_backend, socket}]) of
 9411:         {ok, Sock} ->
 9412:             %% Since we do not know what is going on
 9413:             %% on the machines we run the tests, this
 9414:             %% call "might" actually succeed...
 9415:             ?P("(expected) connect success"),
 9416:             gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 9417:             ok;
 9418:         {error, _Reason} ->
 9419:             ?P("expected failure: "
 9420:                "~n   ~p", [_Reason]),
 9421:             ok
 9422:     catch
 9423:         C:E:S ->
 9424:             ?P("unexpected failure: "
 9425:                "~n   C: ~p"
 9426:                "~n   E: ~p"
 9427:                "~n   S: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 9428:             ct:fail({unexpected_failure, C, E, S})
 9429:     end,
 9430: 
 9431:     ?P("done"),
 9432:     ok.
 9433: 
 9434: 
 9435: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9436: 
 9437: is_windows() ->
 9438:     case os:type() of
 9439:         {win32, nt} ->
 9440:             true;
 9441:         _ ->
 9442:             false
 9443:     end.
 9444: 
 9445: is_linux() ->
 9446:     is_unix(linux, "Linux").
 9447: 
 9448: is_unix(Name, PlatformStr) ->
 9449:     is_platform(unix, Name, PlatformStr).
 9450: 
 9451: is_platform(Family, Name, PlatformStr)
 9452:   when is_atom(Family) andalso
 9453:        is_atom(Name) andalso
 9454:        is_list(PlatformStr) ->
 9455:     case os:type() of
 9456:         {Family, Name} ->
 9457:             ok;
 9458:         _ ->
 9459:             skip("Require " ++ PlatformStr)
 9460:     end.
 9461:   
 9462: 
 9463: is_socket_supported() ->
 9464:     try socket:info() of
 9465:         #{} ->
 9466:             ok
 9467:     catch
 9468:         error : notsup ->
 9469:             skip("esock not supported");
 9470:         error : undef ->
 9471:             skip("esock not configured")
 9472:     end.
 9473: 
 9474: has_support_sock_priority() ->
 9475:     has_support_socket_option_sock(priority).
 9476: 
 9477: has_support_sock_bindtodevice() ->
 9478:     has_support_socket_option_sock(bindtodevice).
 9479: 
 9480: has_support_socket_option_sock(Opt) ->
 9481:     has_support_socket_option(socket, Opt).
 9482: 
 9483: has_support_socket_option(Level, Option) ->
 9484:     case socket:is_supported(options, Level, Option) of
 9485:         true ->
 9486:             ok;
 9487:         false ->
 9488:             skip(?F("Not Supported: ~w option ~w", [Level, Option]))
 9489:     end.
 9490: 
 9491: 
 9492: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9493: 
 9494: skip(Reason) ->
 9495:     throw({skip, Reason}).
 9496: 
 9497: 
 9498: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9499: 
 9500: messages() ->
 9501:     pi(messages).
 9502: 
 9503: links() ->
 9504:     pi(links).
 9505: 
 9506: monitors() ->
 9507:     pi(monitors).
 9508: 
 9509: pi(Pid) when is_pid(Pid) ->
 9510:     process_info(Pid);
 9511: 
 9512: pi(Item) ->
 9513:     pi(self(), Item).
 9514: 
 9515: pi(Pid, Item) ->
 9516:     {Item, Val} = process_info(Pid, Item),
 9517:     Val.    
 9518: 
 9519: 
 9520: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9521: 
 9522: send_failed_str(Reason) ->
 9523:     ?F("Send failed: ~w", [Reason]).
 9524: 
 9525: connect_failed_str(Reason) ->
 9526:     ?F("Connect failed: ~w", [Reason]).
 9527: 
 9528: listen_failed_str(Reason) ->
 9529:     ?F("Listen failed: ~w", [Reason]).
 9530: 
 9531: accept_failed_str(Reason) ->
 9532:     ?F("Accept failed: ~w", [Reason]).
 9533: 
 9534: port_failed_str(Reason) ->
 9535:     ?F("Port failed: ~w", [Reason]).
